At TechNvst, we‚Äôre dedicated to driving growth and scaling solution integrators through strategic corporate collaboration and market access facilitation. We believe in the power of small businesses as the backbone of Africa‚Äôs economy, and we‚Äôre committed to supporting their journey towards scaling and success.

Dive into the latest insights with the State of Tech in Africa 2023 Report by Africa Arena. This comprehensive report offers a deep dive into the evolving tech landscape and the critical role of innovation in shaping Africa‚Äôs future.

üîó https://www.africarena.com Let‚Äôs continue to drive innovation and unlock new opportunities for Africa‚Äôs tech ecosystem! #TechNvst #Innovation #AfricaTech #SmallBusiness #MarketAccess #CorporateCollaboration #TechReport #AfricaArena AFRICARISE | AfricArena africarena.com 5 Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Blessing Douglas Convener for Boma Prize for Africa | Social Impact Ecosystem Builder | Championing Entrepreneurship, Innovation & Funding Access in Africa | Nonprofit & Startup Growth Strategist | Hult Prize 9mo Report this post Every journey begins with a vision, but sustaining that vision through challenges requires unwavering strength and resilience. When I founded the Boma Prize for Africa, my mission was clear: to empower and uplift the most innovative minds across the continent that will eventually put Africans on the global map. But the path has not been without its storms.

In this picture, I hold a cup that symbolizes more than just a beverage; it represents the fuel that drives my passion and determination every single day. From day one, my faith has been my cornerstone. As Romans 8:31 reminds us, ‚ÄúIf God is for us, who can be against us?‚Äù This belief has fortified me through every obstacle, ensuring that I never lose sight of my purpose.

Unstoppable people carry a spirit that propels them beyond their limits. As Philippians 4:13 says, ‚ÄúI can do all things through Christ who strengthens me.‚Äù This verse is a testament to the strength that fuels my journey. Despite the challenges, despite the setbacks, I continue to push forward. The Boma Prize for Africa is now a little over a month away, and every day brings new hurdles. Yet, every day also brings new victories.

Starting this initiative was not just about creating an event; it was about building a platform for change, for innovation, and for growth. The support from our sponsors and the community has been incredible, reinforcing my belief that together, we can achieve greatness.

As we approach the event, I am reminded of the power of perseverance. The storms have come, but they have only made me stronger. Each challenge has been a lesson, each obstacle an opportunity to grow. And here we are, standing strong, ready to showcase the brilliance that Africa has to offer Abuja this coming July.

To everyone facing their own battles, remember that your strength lies within. Keep pushing, keep striving, and know that you are capable of extraordinary things. We're thrilled to share some exciting news with you. First,  Public Art Africa is no longer a separate organization from ur4Africa though it has always been a subsidiary of UR4Africa , we are basically condensing platforms for effective management and to improve our productivity, UR4Africa oversees PAA as one of the projects under her.

WHAT IS UR4AFRICA?
UR4Africa Project, Inc., founded in 2013, is a pan-African space that creates a pathway for the global African diaspora to collaborate with African people to uplift Africa. 

As a registered 501c(3) organization, it is our intention to curate intersectional opportunities for people interested in community building, skill-sharing, investment, and exchanging positive stories about the continent of Africa. To achieve this, we initiated: public Art Africa project, The Exchange Program, The Think Tank and the Public Awareness Service.

Our vision for Public Art Africa is to create programs to engage and educate young minds, preparing them for the future by nurturing and harnessing their talents through active and quality mentorship.

The Exchange Program facilitates cross-cultural exchange and collaborations between individuals and organizations across Africa. Last year, we had a collaboration with OLA ( Otherwise Life For All) in Benin Republic, West Africa. we're also excited to welcome a volunteer from France, and many others.

Public Service Awareness
Our PSA initiatives focus on creating awareness through contents that reflect the beauty of Africa and that has the capacity to drive positive changes in Africa. 

The Think Tank
The Think Tank is a platform for critical thinking, and discourse of pressing issues facing Africa today. It is a team of different individuals from different fields to generate innovative solutions and ideas to address some of the continent's challenges, membership into this is completely free, you can jump in with just a mail.

Each of the programs are guided by shared purpose and the big picture is to connect Africans, build Africa and redefine the narrative through the spirit of Pan-Africanism. By "pan-Africanism" we refer to  the movement that aims to promote solidarity, unity, and cooperation among people of African descent, regardless of their geographic location.

We invite you to Join us on this journey of transforming Africa. you have questions or enquiries? Please visit UR4Africa.org , subscribe and follow our page on Instagram, LinkedIn and. Advancing #IndigenousEconomy & IndigenomicsAI #indigenousAI 11mo The Global Centre of Indigenomics is seeking Indigenous speakers from across the globe for the inaugural Indigenomics NOW Forum, taking place on November 14th, 2024.

This inaugural 24-hour virtual forum is dedicated to amplifying Indigenous economic knowledge worldwide. It is building a critical perspective from the question- How can we build economies with Life at the Centre? 

The forum agenda draws inspiration from the rhythms of the natural world‚Äîthe 13 moons, the 4 directions‚Äîall converging into a rich tapestry Indigenous economic and business worldview.

EF-Tu \(elongation factor thermo unstable\) is a prokaryotic elongation factor responsible for catalyzing the binding of an aminoacyl-tRNA \(aa-tRNA\) to the ribosome. It is a G-protein, and facilitates the selection and binding of an aa-tRNA to the A-site of the ribosome. As a reflection of its crucial role in translation, EF-Tu is one of the most abundant and highly conserved proteins in prokaryotes.

Click here for the full article: https://bit.ly/4dgYdiB In 1971, the financial world changed forever with the advent of science-based investing. Research from academics like Gene Fama revealed that markets efficiently price in all available information, making traditional stock-picking ineffective. This breakthrough paved the way for index funds and the democratization of investing, allowing anyone to capture market returns without speculation. Lead Like A Feminist 7,652 followers 4mo How can we re-weave the tapestry of global politics through better representation of diverse women? ü§î 

This event highlighted 3 themes- current barriers that can be transformed into catalysts for more diverse representation üëâ 

üíõ Funding and investment
The lack of investment in women‚Äôs political power is a critical barrier to achieving gender equality in governance.¬† 

üí• Less than 1% of philanthropic funds go towards women‚Äôs movements, and even less towards supporting women in politics üí•

BUT more diverse representation is good for the world
üëâ less corruption
üëâ lower maternal and infant mortality rates
üëâ more growth alongside more stringent climate change policies and lower carbon dioxide emissions

üíõ Violence and harassment
The pervasive nature of violence and harassment is a key obstacle for women in politics

üí•Women in politics are at least 3.4 times more likely to experience threats and harassment compared to men, manifesting both in traditional, physical forms and increasingly in the digital sphere.üí•

The significant gap in institutional protection holds everyone back and the risks are only heightened for politicians from the LGBTQI+ community, religious minorities and the disabilities community.

üíõNarratives and Storytelling
The challenge of increasing women‚Äôs political representation goes beyond mere numbers.

üëâIt requires a fundamental shift in how we perceive and portray women in leadership roles.
üëâThere‚Äôs a critical need to reframe narratives around diversity in politics. 

6 essential steps to push forwardüëâ

üí• Advocate for and invest in data-driven insights
üí• Engage with tech platforms to develop safeguards
üí• Collaborate with political parties on reforms
üí• Champion increased investment in training and support
üí• Prioritise mental wellbeing and resilience
üí• Amplify and elevate diverse voices

The report is brought to us by Shape History , summarising an event with:

üíõ Irene M. Executive Director, Pollicy , a feminist collective of technologists, data scientists, creatives and academics working at the intersection of data, design and technology to craft better life experiences by harnessing improved data.

üíõ Suyen Barahona Cuan , Executive Director, Colmena Fund , a nascent fund dedicated to support and drive women‚Äôs political leadership across the Global South.

üíõ Lindiwe Mazibuko , Founder & CEO, Futurelect , unlocking active citizenry through knowledge.

üíõ Ayesha Gardiner , Associate Strategy Director, Shape History, a¬†B Corp Certified, majority women & LGBTI+ owned independent¬†communications agency, working with purpose-led companies, philanthropic institutions, ESG innovators, charities, and global campaigns on the biggest issues facing humanity today. #feminist #leadership #politics Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in PRIMA NEXUS‚ÄìNESS 601 followers 3mo Edited Report this post Protecting the Future with Women‚Äôs Leadership

Women are often the first to feel the impacts of ecosystem degradation, but they also hold invaluable local knowledge about natural resources. Including them in decision-making processes is crucial for sustainable management.

Nakiranda , Project Lead at Value For Women Ltd. , will be at the Acumen Green Climate Fund Conference on Wednesday. 

We're looking forward to a thought-provoking discussion on the challenges and opportunities of bringing a gender lens to climate action!

The session will draw on insights from the recently published report - Pathways to Growth: Gender-smart actions that work - by Value For Women Ltd. , Acumen and 60 Decibels . 

üìïPathways to Growth draws on Value For Women Ltd. and Acumen ‚Äôs decade plus of supporting 100+ early-stage companies with technical advisory, and our broader market work with 1,000+ companies. It showcases actionable pathways for early-stage companies in emerging market contexts to effect change and to improve opportunities for women in the workforce. 

üîóHere's the link to the report, in case you haven't already seen it: https://lnkd.in/dxfKAVa5 ) 

If this interests you, or you'd like to know more about our upcoming initiatives to support early stage and high growth enterprises in accelerating gender inclusion, do reach out! As the number of women-led organizations addressing these critical issues grows, MM2030 recognizes the necessity of fostering collaboration among these key players.

Women are key players in the food system, yet they often lack the recognition and resources they need. 

In the Mediterranean region, women contribute significantly to greening food systems. From producers and innovators to decision-makers, they are essential in driving sustainable practices. Despite structural barriers, their leadership ensures resilience and inclusivity. However, women's contributions are often undervalued, particularly due to unpaid agricultural work and involvement in informal or shadow agri-food labour market.¬†Recognizing and supporting their role is vital for a greener future.

In Europe, women are transforming agriculture through innovative practices that prioritize sustainability and environmental stewardship. As key players in the green transition, they‚Äôre driving the adoption of agroecological methods, fostering biodiversity, and reducing agriculture's carbon footprint. Yet, they face challenges in accessing resources and decision-making spaces.

Empowering women is essential for creating a more resilient and sustainable food system. Discover more about women‚Äôs pivotal role in sustainable agriculture and join the movement for change!

Learn how initiatives like the NEXUS-NESS project and EU programs are supporting women‚Äôs leadership in greening agriculture: https://lnkd.in/d8EgmScw Discover how empowering women strengthens agriculture and food systems across the Mediterranean, fostering sustainability and social cohesion: https://lnkd.in/dTd_9mw6 Gender equality is key to building a more sustainable and inclusive WEFE Nexus. Extracted_Text:
#indigenousentrepreneur #indigenomics #indigenousbusiness‚Ä¶ | Trent Billette ü™∂ Agree & Join LinkedIn By clicking Continue to join or sign in, you agree to LinkedIn‚Äôs User Agreement , Privacy Policy , and Cookie Policy . Skip to main content LinkedIn Articles People Learning Jobs Games Join now Sign in Trent Billette ü™∂‚Äôs Post Trent Billette ü™∂ Indigenous Motivational Speaker | Dene Tech Innovator ü™∂ | Social Entrepreneur | Community Builder | Proud Member of Buffalo River Dene Nation | Empowering Indigenous Entrepreneurs 2w Edited Report this post üìö My Journey as an Indigenous Entrepreneur: From Reading to Building a Knowledge Library üìö

When I first set out on this journey, I had a simple goal: read one book a month to sharpen my skills as an entrepreneur. But somewhere along the way, I realized this was bigger than just reading. I wasn‚Äôt just consuming knowledge‚ÄîI was collecting it, curating it, and applying it to build something greater: Indigpreneur.

As Indigenous people, our knowledge has always been passed down through stories, teachings, and lived experience. Today, books have become another way for me to learn from those who came before us‚Äîleaders, thinkers, and changemakers who have built businesses, disrupted industries, and reshaped economies.

üìñ Starting with ‚ÄúIndigenomics: Taking a Seat at the Economic Table‚Äù by Carol Anne Hilton, MBA, ICD.D This book isn‚Äôt just a read‚Äîit‚Äôs a blueprint. Hilton lays out how Indigenous people can reclaim economic power, create wealth in our communities, and move beyond surviving to thriving in business. It‚Äôs a powerful reminder that we don‚Äôt need to fit into existing systems‚Äîwe can build our own.

üöÄ How Indigpreneur Will Implement These Teachings:

‚úÖ Building Indigenous-Led Networks: Indigenomics highlights the need for strong Indigenous business ecosystems. Through Indigpreneur, I‚Äôm focused on creating a network where Indigenous entrepreneurs collaborate, share resources, and grow together.

‚úÖ Creating Wealth, Not Just Jobs: Hilton talks about the importance of ownership. Indigpreneur isn‚Äôt just about helping Indigenous businesses start‚Äîit‚Äôs about helping them scale, sustain, and create long-term wealth in our communities.

‚úÖ Elevating Indigenous Innovation: Indigenous knowledge and ways of doing business are an advantage, not a limitation. I want Indigpreneur to champion modern Indigenous business models‚Äîones rooted in our values, but thriving in today‚Äôs economy.

üì¢ This isn‚Äôt just about me‚Äîit‚Äôs about all of us. If you‚Äôre an Indigenous entrepreneur, business leader, or changemaker, let‚Äôs connect and share knowledge.

üèÜ Join the Indigenous Entrepreneur Roundtable

At the end of this month, I‚Äôm hosting a roundtable discussion where we‚Äôll explore how we can take action on these ideas, share insights, and connect as Indigenous entrepreneurs.

üîó Register here: https://lnkd.in/g-EhkV57 üìñ What books have shaped your mindset? How do you see Indigenous business evolving? #indigenomics #economicreconciliation #telus #indigenouseconomy #ai‚Ä¶ | Indigenomics Agree & Join LinkedIn By clicking Continue to join or sign in, you agree to LinkedIn‚Äôs User Agreement , Privacy Policy , and Cookie Policy . Skip to main content LinkedIn Articles People Learning Jobs Games Join now Sign in Indigenomics‚Äô Post Indigenomics 4,887 followers 4mo Edited Report this post We are deeply grateful to TELUS for their ongoing commitment as our Platinum Multi-Year Events Partner, and for their participation in Indigenomics by DESIGN, SHE, BAY STREET, and the National Indigenomics AI Generative Study this year! Their contributions have been outstanding, and we appreciate how they continue to collaborate and play Indigenomics with us! 

TELUS engaged in various ways this year‚Äîas speakers, vendors, advisors, and hosts. At Indigenomics SHE, Kara Moss , Clinical Supervisor at TELUS Health, shared her insights on the Indigenous Women Leading in Corporate Reconciliation panel. At Indigenomics on BAY STREET, Jesslyn Dymond , Director of AI Governance & Data Ethics, contributed to the panel on AI and the Next Indigenous Economy, while also serving as an advisor on the National Indigenomics AI Generative Study. On Innovation Day, TELUS hosted an Indigenous Placekeeping Tour at TELUS Harbour, showcasing how culturally responsive experiences can be integrated into corporate spaces. Additionally, Amanda Lee, Emily Piccinin , Leila Ashurov , Chloe Santiago , Neil Conti, and Denis Lacasse engaged with conference attendees at DESIGN, SHE, and BAY STREET at the TELUS booth. 

We also want to extend our thanks to the TELUS team members we work with, including Kristen Sandhu , Stephanie Han , Yoelit Lipinsky, PhD , Christy Morgan and Marissa Nobauer ‚Äîwe appreciate you! 

We deeply value TELUS's commitment to playing #Indigenomics and walking with us in advancing economic reconciliation.

Like Reply 1¬†Reaction 2¬†Reactions TELUS 4mo Report this comment We are honoured and proud to work with you üíú Like Reply 1¬†Reaction 2¬†Reactions Marissa Nobauer 2024 YWCA Women of Distinction Nominee | strategic and purpose driven leader | coaching high performing teams | operational excellence | relationship builder. 4mo Report this comment Looking forward to seeing how indigenomics continues to lead and drive change for a more prosperous future. üëè Like Reply 2¬†Reactions 3¬†Reactions See more comments To view or add a comment, sign in More Relevant Posts Ann Aerts Head of the Novartis Foundation 6mo Report this post Everyone deserves a chance to live a long and healthy life. Thanks to tech and AI, this goal is within reach!
¬†
This year‚Äôs Summit of the Future by the International Telecommunication Union and UNDP is a powerful reminder that we need to put ourselves back on a better path. We are not on track to meet the goals we have set for our global community, and new challenges are already on the horizon.

This is especially true for health and care: our systems are creaking under ever-growing pressures, and the pace at which inequities are growing appears to outrun the speed of innovation. But there is hope.
¬†
I was delighted to take the stage and speak about the transformative potential that AI and advanced analytics bring to health and care. These tools can help us identify the true drivers of health and equip decision makers with the insights they need to design impactful interventions ‚Äì ultimately keeping us all healthy in the first place.

On September 24, the Novartis Foundation will reveal such AI-driven insights on potential determinants of heart health in New York City, doing our part in paving the way to a healthier and more equitable tomorrow. Stay tuned! #DigitalFutureForAll #SDGdigital #UNGA79 246 4 Comments Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in SFCS Architects 2,225 followers 4mo Report this post A massive highlight at the #ICAA2024 Conference was Mark Kronner's presentation on "Artificial Intelligence: Revolutionizing Well-being and Operations." Additional space needed to be open to accommodate everyone who was interested!

Kronner's insights centered around how AI is a transformative tool empowering staff and seniors in everything from streamlining daily tasks to enabling collaborative decision-making. The key? Thoughtful, personalized integration that respects individual autonomy while enhancing quality of life.

The packed session and expanded space sent a clear message: The senior living industry is embracing technological innovation like never before.

Thanks ICAA for organizing a great conference! #SeniorLiving #AIInnovation #Healthcare #TechnologyTransformation International Council on Active Aging 4 Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Michael Bidu Entrepreneur. How can artificial intelligence revolutionize the health of individuals, communities, and organizations? At the Canada-Italy Forum on AI & Well-Being, the session "Our Health: Well-being of Individuals and Communities" delved into this critical topic.

Key questions addressed:
 üîπ How can AI enhance health, preventive care, diagnostics, and therapeutics?
 üîπ What impact does AI have on promoting well-being across diverse communities?

üí° Watch the session to discover insights into how AI is shaping the future of healthcare and fostering healthier communities.

During the Canada-Italy Forum on AI & Well-Being, I had the opportunity to present "Multi-modal modeling of Eye Imaging to predict Dementia in the CALLIOPE Urban Health Initiative". This innovative approach leverages AI-driven algorithms and angio-OCT imaging to detect novel retinal biomarkers, offering a non-invasive, cost-effective way to classify neurocognitive diseases such as Alzheimer's.

üî¨ By combining retinal imaging with data from clinical, lifestyle, and socio-economic factors, we aim to:
- Improve early detection of dementia.
- Enhance prediction models using machine learning and multi-modal data fusion.
- Pave the way for integrative health solutions in urban contexts.

This work underscores the potential of technology and interdisciplinary collaboration in addressing the global dementia challenge, with over 50 million people affected today‚Äîa number expected to surpass 74 million by 2030.

Bilal A Mateen 's opening remarks about the threats of removing humans from the center of AI framed the conversations nicely, and closing remarks from Alain Labrique drove the point home by asking not "how" AI should be used, but rather "if" - a question that is best answered only when the problem is well-defined, the target/recipient population has decreased barriers to access (like compute power! Digital Square at PATH 8,063 followers 9mo Edited üåç‚ú® Exciting developments in digital health! ‚ú®üåç

On June 2nd, PATH and Digital Square at PATH convened at the 3rd Meeting of the G20 Brasil 2024 Health Working Group for a co-branded event, "AI for Science & Health: Ensuring Equitable Impact." Supported by the Wellcome Trust and co-hosted with the World Health Organization , GIDH, and the World Economic Forum , the event addressed how artificial intelligence (AI) can transform healthcare, especially in low- and middle-income countries.

Discussions covered:
ü§ñ The role of AI in improving clinical decision support and medical product development
üåç The importance of localizing digital innovations to benefit the Global South
‚ö† Overcoming challenges such as algorithm biases, data quality issues, and privacy concerns

Pictured below, Ana Estela Haddad , Secretary for Information and Digital Health for the Brazilian Ministry of Health, spoke to Brazil‚Äôs perspective on how the G20 can help facilitate and harness the potential of AI in LMICs: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs important that we work collaboratively together and with responsibility, especially when we think about ethical use of AI‚Ä¶ and that we keep on working on an equitable way to develop strength in our health systems.‚Äù

Our collective goal is to channel AI's potential while ensuring ethical considerations and equitable access to healthcare innovations. This event was a significant step towards a future where AI-driven solutions support global health equity. üåêü©∫ #G20Health #AI4Health #GlobalHealthEquity #DigitalHealth #DigitalTransformation 10 Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in LAMIA RAHAL Woman founder I Health tech I Strategy I Public policy I Government affairs I Regulatory affairs | market access | Business development I 2mo Report this post We‚Äôre thrilled to announce Health Nexus Africa membership to the HealthAI - The Global Agency for Responsible AI in Health Community of Practice ‚Äî a global forum where diverse voices come together to turn ideas into action and advance #ResponsibleAI governance in health.

At the unique intersection of Health, AI, and Regulation, the CoP is designed to foster meaningful collaboration among policymakers, regulators, researchers, civil society, and private sector leaders. 

What makes the CoP special?

‚úÖ  It brings diverse perspectives to the table, including those from low- and middle-income countries, ensuring that local needs and interests shape global AI governance.

‚úÖ  It‚Äôs a space for dialogue, continuous learning, and shared progress‚Äîbecause advancing responsible AI in health requires everyone‚Äôs voice. 96 21 Comments Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Sandeep Pulim M.D. Health care Advocacy, Innovation, Entrepreneurship 3mo Report this post Informative dialog with Amy Sheon Evelyn Gallego, MBA, MPH, CPHIMS & Chethan Sarabu, MD at NODE.Health > Including Gravity Project SDOH standards in adopting AI for digital inclusion strategies for leveraging technology to improve health outcomes across diverse populations https://lnkd.in/erU4r279 40 1 Comment Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in o2h group 16,787 followers 1mo Edited Report this post We are delighted to share the official agenda for 7th edition of the o2h Collaborative Innovation conference. Skip to main content LinkedIn Articles People Learning Jobs Games Join now Sign in Indigenomics‚Äô Post Indigenomics 4,887 followers 1y Report this post "Indigenomics" takes you on a captivating journey, unraveling the intricate web of Indigenous economies. Carol Anne Hilton masterfully intertwines traditional knowledge with modern economic principles, offering a unique perspective on how Indigenous communities can harness their strengths to drive sustainable economic development.

Overview
Indigenomics lays out the tenets of the emerging Indigenous economy, built around relationships, multigenerational stewardship of resources, and care for all. Highlights include:

‚Ä¢	The ongoing power shift and rise of the modern Indigenous economy
‚Ä¢	Voices of leading Indigenous business leaders
‚Ä¢	The unfolding story in the law courts that is testing Canada's relationship with Indigenous peoples
‚Ä¢	Exposure of the false media narrative of Indigenous dependency
‚Ä¢	A new narrative, rooted in the reality on the ground, that Indigenous peoples are economic powerhouses.

Join the conversation on reshaping the economic landscape, fostering cultural harmony, and building a future where prosperity knows no bounds.

Skip to main content LinkedIn Articles People Learning Jobs Games Join now Sign in Shazia Sobani‚Äôs Post Shazia Sobani Vice-president Fibre Networks & Customer Solutions Delivery at TELUS 12mo Report this post TELUS is proud to partner with the Indigenomics Institute, embracing our shared vision that, together with Indigenous Peoples, we can incorporate Indigenous perspectives into how the economy functions and benefits all people in Canada. Our commitment to reconciliation goes beyond words - it's about action. This includes ensuring that Indigenous experts, leaders, and organizations have the platform to share their insights and expertise, which is why we are proud to be a multi-year event partner with the Indigenomics Institute. 

Registration for the Indigenomics by Design conference is now open! For those located in and near Saskatoon, SK, we warmly invite you to join this transformative event for an unparalleled opportunity to learn from visionaries like Carol Anne Hilton, MBA, ICD.D , who are at the forefront of guiding corporate Canada towards viewing the economy through an Indigenous lens.

üîó https://lnkd.in/gT8NGHiB Carol Anne Hilton, MBA, ICD.D Founder of #Indigenomics movement- Indigenomics Institute, Global Centre Indigenomics & Indigenous Technology House. Entrepreneur, Author x 2, Speaker, Advisor. Advancing #IndigenousEconomy & IndigenomicsAI #indigenousAI 1y The Indigenomics Design- Indigenous Wealth Dynamics agenda is LIVE!

Join us as we engage in Indigenous perspectives on shifting concepts of Indigenous wealth, Healing our modern relationship with money, poverty, and abundance through financial education, distribution, financial empowerment, sovereign wealth funds.

Let's rewrite the narrative of wealth through an Indigenous lens, transforming our relationship with finance, commerce, investment, and capital markets.

Attention all corners of northern BC's mining industry! Red Chris is rallying the troops for Movember 2024, and we want everyone on board!

From producing mines like us, Brucejack, and Mount Milligan, to advanced projects like Blackwater, Galore Creek, and Skeena Resources' Eskay Creek revitalization, to the dynamic explorers shaping our industry's future - we challenge you all to join the fight for men's health!

Here's how we can make a powerful impact together:

1. Team Spirit: Which project can mobilize the highest percentage of their workforce for Movember?

Since discovering the world-class Havieron gold-copper deposit in 2018, Greatland has evolved from explorer to developer, and soon to be producer. 

Milestones along the way have included partnering with global majors Newcrest & Newmont, resource growth to make Haveron Australia‚Äôs second largest undeveloped gold project, a pre-feasibility study, strategic investment by Wyloo Metals, and now the transformative acquisition of 100% of Havieron and Telfer.

‚ÄòBuying back the farm‚Äô, Greatland has returned sole control to optimise, develop and deliver Havieron‚Äôs full potential. #GGP 156 1 Comment Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Denise Atkinson Founder, CEO, Indigenous Inclusion Advocate 3mo Report this post üåü Empowering Indigenous Engagement in Northwestern Ontario‚Äôs Mining Industry üåü

As the Founder of Tipi Horse, I am incredibly proud of our work in helping foster meaningful Indigenous engagement and cultural awareness within Northwestern Ontario‚Äôs growing mining sector.

Thunder Bay is quickly becoming a key service and supply hub, supporting 9 active mines and over 18 exploration projects. Tipi Horse is honoured to be part of this expanding industry, where we are working to bridge the gap between mining operations and Indigenous communities. Through our Indigenous cultural awareness training and commitment to building respectful, sustainable partnerships, we help ensure that Indigenous voices are heard and their rights respected in the resource development process.

üí° What Tipi Horse Brings to the Table:
‚úîÔ∏è Indigenous-Owned Business: As an Indigenous woman-owned company, we‚Äôre deeply rooted in our cultural values and community connections.
‚úîÔ∏è Cultural Awareness Training: We offer tailored training programs that educate and engage the mining sector on Indigenous history, culture, and protocols, helping foster stronger, more respectful relationships.
‚úîÔ∏è Building Partnerships: We‚Äôre committed to ensuring that partnerships between Indigenous communities and the mining sector are built on trust, mutual respect, and shared benefits.

I was honoured last week to have met Minister Greg Rickford, Ontario‚Äôs Minister of Northern Development and Minister of Indigenous Affairs, to discuss the future of mining and regional development. It was a privilege to be part of such important conversations, and I‚Äôm grateful for the opportunity to contribute to shaping the future of mining in our region.

üëè Tipi Horse is proud to be included in the Thunder Bay Community Economic Development Commission (CEDC) Mining Directory, and I encourage everyone to celebrate and support Indigenous-owned businesses like ours, which are leading the way in creating positive change in the mining sector. #IndigenousBusiness #IndigenousEngagement #CulturalAwareness #TipiHorse #ThunderBay #Mining #NorthwesternOntario #CEDC #GregRickford #Gold #Palladium #Lithium #SupportIndigenous #SustainableMining #CommunityPartnerships #WBECanada #weconnect #CCIB #CCAB #womanownedbusiness 55 1 Comment Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Peter Mhone Geologist at Zambia Gold Company 4mo Edited Report this post CSR's role in sustainable mining as far as communities are concerned is of paramount importance as long as the needs of the communities are met. üöÄ Investing with Impact: Squire Servance on Health Equity & Venture Capital - proving that profitability and purpose can coexist.

üéôÔ∏è What's in the Episode:
1Ô∏è‚É£ Investing in Overlooked Markets: Learn how health disparities create massive untapped opportunities for innovation and investment.
2Ô∏è‚É£ The Power of Diversity:¬†Squire Servance explains why investing in diverse founders and solutions yields better outcomes for both society and investors.
3Ô∏è‚É£ Data-Driven Impact:¬†Discover how Servance evaluates companies to ensure they drive both health equity progress and financial returns.


üìå Quotes:
(00:08:10) "The love just kind of grew, grew from there."
(00:39:02) "Accelerating health equity, while generating returns, transforms lives and society."
(00:57:45) "You can do good and do well by directing capitalism towards health equity."

Remember Theranos? Elizabeth Holmes promised revolutionary blood-testing technology and dazzled everyone with confidence and ambition. But behind the scenes, the tech didn‚Äôt work. When the truth came out, trust crumbled, and the fallout was massive‚Äînot just for the company but for everyone who believed in it.¬† 

Now, look at Cotopaxi. They‚Äôve built their brand differently, with purpose and transparency at the core. From committing a portion of profits to fight global poverty to crafting sustainable products, Cotopaxi doesn‚Äôt just make promises‚Äîthey deliver. Their actions have created a loyal community that believes in their mission.¬† 

The takeaway? 

Trying to build connections on false faces or exaggerated pretenses is like laying a foundation on quicksand. It might hold for a moment, but it won‚Äôt last. People can see through the noise, and what they want is something real. #Legendeering #Leadership #Authenticity #Trust Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Ryan Goodland Reimagining Life Science Recruitment at Goodland Pharma 11mo Report this post Embracing change is not merely a choice but a necessity for growth and resilience.

Some of the notable movements include Emeco Group Holdings Ltd‚Äôs appointment of Ian Macliver as Chairman, Adriatic Metals Plc ‚Äôs appointment of Laura Tyler as Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer, and Cobram Estate Olives Limited 's appointment of Anabel Godino as Group Chief Financial Officer.

Visit blenheimpartners.com to follow our weekly State of the Market updates. #industrials #mining #consumer #executivesearch #chair #ceo #cfo State of the Market: October 2024 10 Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Prospect Resources Limited 9,623 followers 4mo Report this post Prospect Resources confirms the retirement of Non-Executive Director, Mr. Zed Rusike , effective today.
¬†
Zed has been a cornerstone of Prospect‚Äôs journey since its inception, serving as a founding director and guiding the company through transformative milestones. Under his stewardship, Prospect assembled a robust portfolio of exploration assets, leading to the discovery and development of the Arcadia Lithium Project - a globally recognised, top-ten hard rock lithium asset.
¬†
Zed‚Äôs strategic vision played a pivotal role in Prospect‚Äôs evolution, from the discovery of Arcadia to its successful sale to Huayou Cobalt in 2022. His leadership also helped establish the company in Zambia, culminating in the acquisition of the Mumbezhi Copper Project, which underpins our current growth trajectory.
¬†
Non-Executive Chairperson Mark Wheatley shared:
‚ÄúI would like to take this opportunity to thank Zed for all his efforts over the past 11 years. Zed has been a sage Director of the Company, and the board has valued his experience, leadership and calm approach to business through what has been a transformative growth period for the Company. I have really enjoyed working with him.‚Äù
¬†
‚ÄúZed has always been relied on to provide an external perspective and independent judgment towards the needs of our shareholders. He now feels comforted that the company is on a steady and progressive pathway with Mumbezhi Copper Project which provides a responsible opportunity for renewal at Board level.‚Äù 
¬†
‚ÄúWe wish Zed every success with his personal ventures and wish to express our most sincere gratitude for his dedication and service as a Non-Executive to Prospect Resources‚Äù
¬†
As Zed transitions into the next chapter of his journey, we honour his legacy and remain committed to the progressive pathway he helped establish. Advancing #IndigenousEconomy & IndigenomicsAI #indigenousAI 2w Report this post Indigenomics IMPACT experience is an immersive journey into Indigenous economic reconciliation. Through XR storytelling, digital landscapes, and interactive exhibits at the H.R. MacMillan Space Centre‚Äôs Star Dome.
 
This forum highlights Indigenous economic reconciliation outcomes in the Indigenous economy.  The forum will feature the dome experience at the HR MacMillan Space Center and an immersive Indigenomics AI platform to build real time insights for participants. Further, the forum offers an interactive digital landscape and XR-enhanced narratives with the goal to create an embodied experience through Indigenous-led economic and cultural realities. This inaugural gathering aims to bring together Indigenous businesses, corporations, investors, governments and allies to activate Indigenous economic outcomes.

Title: Join us for a session on $100 Billion Indigenous Economy - LinkedIn
Description: Nov 3, 2023  ¬∑  Register here: https://lnkd.in/evegFEqn #Indigenomics #IndigenousLeaders #EconomicProsperity #BayStreetConference #EconomicReconciliation¬†...
Extracted_Text:
Join us for a session on $100 Billion Indigenous Economy | Indigenomics posted on the topic | LinkedIn Agree & Join LinkedIn By clicking Continue to join or sign in, you agree to LinkedIn‚Äôs User Agreement , Privacy Policy , and Cookie Policy . Skip to main content LinkedIn Articles People Learning Jobs Games Join now Sign in Indigenomics‚Äô Post Indigenomics 4,887 followers 1y Report this post The Road to a $100 Billion Indigenous Economy! This ambitious vision is within our reach, but it requires the collective strength and wisdom of Indigenous business leaders from coast to coast.

Join us for a game-changing session led by distinguished visionaries: Chana Martineau BA, ICD.D , CEO, Alberta Indigenous Opportunities Corporation , Derrick Neeposh , CREECO, Ted Bauer , Alberta Indigenous Opportunities Corporation , and Crystal Chief   B.A., M. Ed. , Haisla Nation Council. They will guide us through the strategic pathways to achieve this monumental goal.  In this exclusive discussion, we will delve into:

-The blueprint for success: Insights and strategies to help Indigenous businesses strategically navigate towards a $100 billion economy.
-Building bridges: Discover what's needed from corporate partners and governments to create an enabling environment for Indigenous economic empowerment.
-Expert perspectives: Gain invaluable knowledge from two leaders who have blazed trails in Indigenous entrepreneurship and economic development.

But hurry, time is of the essence! Only 11 days left to register and be part of this historic dialogue that will shape the future of Indigenous economic empowerment.
Secure your spot now, and let's embark on this transformational journey together.  Don't miss out on your chance to be a part of this pivotal moment in history.

Title: Indigenomics on LinkedIn
Description: Jul 29, 2024  ¬∑  We are thrilled to announce that Anishinaabe and settler folk-soul musician Ila Barker will be gracing the stage with her musical talents at¬†...
Extracted_Text:
#indigenomics #indigenouseconomy #indigenousbusiness #indigenousprosperity‚Ä¶ | Indigenomics Agree & Join LinkedIn By clicking Continue to join or sign in, you agree to LinkedIn‚Äôs User Agreement , Privacy Policy , and Cookie Policy . Skip to main content LinkedIn Articles People Learning Jobs Games Join now Sign in Indigenomics‚Äô Post Indigenomics 4,887 followers 8mo Edited Report this post We are thrilled to announce that Anishinaabe and settler folk-soul musician Ila Barker will be gracing the stage with her musical talents at the Indigenomics SHE Reception on September 23rd!

A heartfelt welcome to Ila and a special thank you to RBC , our valued Reception Sponsor, for joining us once again.

Join us at the 3rd annual Indigenomics SHE event as we celebrate the achievements, leadership, experiences, and voices of Indigenous women in business who are advancing the Indigenous economy.

Regular ticket rate ends August 15! Have you secured your tickets? https://lnkd.in/gJaK7t3H Indigenomics conference rate $179/night available until September 9th!
Book your stay at Wyndham Garden Airport Hotel: https://lnkd.in/g_FxQAAJ #Indigenomics #IndigenousEconomy #IndigenousBusiness #IndigenousProsperity #Winnipeg #IndigenousEntrepreneurship #MANECON #WomenInBusiness #EconomicReconciliation 21 Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in More Relevant Posts Janice Polizzotto Passionate about making the world a better place through social impact investments. 9mo Report this post Proud to be a new member of #TheAuthenticAsian , striving to help Asian American Female Leaders feel more connected and less alone through an Exclusive AAPI Female Leader community. We believe that by providing a supportive network, we can empower AAPI Female Leaders to achieve their goals and make a difference in their communities. I can't wait to meet and connect with like-minded women while also serving as a mentor to others. DM me if you'd like to learn more.
. #AAPI #AAPIFemaleLeaders 33 Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Marisa Kamall Founder at GAIA leading women's network for growth. 5mo Report this post Pinch me (again!). GAIA is growing ‚ú® 

Another incredible GAIA meeting, and I‚Äôm forever in awe of the amazing women in this group. We all come from different backgrounds and experiences, yet we are bonded by common values‚Äîrespect for one another, humanity, and the desire to become better leaders both personally and professionally.

Every session brings those "aha" moments that leave me inspired. This week, we dived into Big Hairy Audacious Goals (BHAGs). While everything we discuss is, of course, confidential, my biggest takeaway is powerful‚Äîno one is chasing money. We‚Äôre all focused on something far more meaningful: creating a wider social impact and improving the lives of those around us.

The genuine connections we build in GAIA don't happen without this kind of engagement. It‚Äôs different from being with friends, and these are conversations you just can‚Äôt have with colleagues. 

If you're interested in what GAIA is and how you can be a part of it, drop me a DM, and we can set up a short call to see if there's a good mutual fit.

I was privileged to attend the Thrive Women's Summit organized by the Women Power House led by Faith Fetaru .

Here‚Äôs what stood out for me:
üåπ The importance of collaboration and how it impacts the growth of a business or organization, shared by Henriette Paula Mugisa, Belinda Esaete Regina, and Constansia Nakinda:
üìå Tapping into each other's already established market.
üìå Reaching more people and creating greater impact.
üìå Widening networks.
üìå Learning from each other.
üìå Helping each other achieve their vision.

üåπ Every woman is a queen in her kingdom and has 7 powers, as explained by Jacqueline Asiimwe :
üìå Power of Purpose: Why are you still alive? Why were you born?
üìå Power of People: Who are the people attached to your purpose? The people you are meant to serve‚Äîhow do you treat them?
üìå Power of Place: Where do you want to create impact? Is it in your professional space, family, or your community?
üìå Power of Privilege: What privileges do you have that can support your purpose? Is it your personality, education, background, experiences, or exposure?
üìå Power of Pleasure: What brings you satisfaction and joy? How often do you make time for it‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs a hobby, self-care, or a passion?
üìå Power of Purse: What are your financial habits? What‚Äôs your generosity quotient? How are you managing the resources you have?
üìå Power of Pain: How do you deal with your pain? Does it control you, or are you using it for your good?

üåπ Every person is a leader, and your purpose is your area of leadership! Betty Ogiel highlighted the 3A‚Äôs of leadership:
üìå Assess: Who are you? What are your strengths, weaknesses, and purpose?
üìå Accept: After self-assessment, accept who you are. Change what you can and accept what you cannot.
üìå Action: There‚Äôs no change or transformation without action. Take action!

¬†
We discussed how much Davos‚Äîand the world‚Äîhas changed since 1999. Back then, optimism about European integration, globalisation, and the tech boom shaped the discussions. Today, in 2025, we stand at a crossroads: faced with climate urgency, AI governance, and deepening inequalities, leaders must choose between collaboration or fragmentation, action or inaction.
¬†
Martin shared memories of Davos 2000 when President Clinton became the first sitting U.S. president to attend. His visit symbolised a belief in global cooperation, which is much like what we‚Äôre striving for today.
That same year, the GAVI Alliance was launched at Davos, a partnership that has since saved millions of lives by ensuring vaccine access worldwide.
¬†
That moment felt like a parallel to today: the stakes are high, but so is the potential for impact. I see this daily in my work, primarily through partnerships with healthcare companies and philanthropic foundations‚Äîorganisations whose commitment to global health and equity continues to drive real change.
¬†
My Davos moment this year? Realising that while the world has changed, the power of collaboration and partnerships remains just as strong. #WEF25 #Leadership #Collaboration #Partnerships #GlobalHealth #Hope 112 4 Comments Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in unDavos Summit 2,295 followers 2mo Edited Report this post üåç Behind the Curtains of Davos: A World Beyond the Forum

Skip to main content LinkedIn Articles People Learning Jobs Games Join now Sign in Carol Anne Hilton, MBA, ICD.D‚Äôs Post Carol Anne Hilton, MBA, ICD.D Founder of #Indigenomics movement- Indigenomics Institute, Global Centre Indigenomics & Indigenous Technology House. Entrepreneur, Author x 2, Speaker, Advisor. Advancing #IndigenousEconomy & IndigenomicsAI #indigenousAI 2w Report this post #indigenomics in action #indigenouseconomy First Nations Finance Authority 7,936 followers 2w Edited INDIGENOUS COMMUNITUES ESSENTIAL TO CANADA‚ÄôS ECONOMY 
 
Ogen's message was clear: First Nations are determined to be active participants in shaping their own futures. They seek partnerships built on respect, trust, and a shared vision for economic prosperity.
 
The Cedar LNG project, spearheaded by the Haisla Nation , stands as a groundbreaking example of Indigenous ownership in the LNG sector. The Coastal GasLink pipeline offered First Nations along its route a 10% equity stake, ensuring long-term revenue streams, procurement opportunities, jobs, and training.
 
Full story: https://shorturl.at/e7bSy Image: Karen Ogen, Chief Executive Officer of the First Nations LNG Alliance #FNFA #Haisla #economicdevelopment #investinIndigenous #investinCanada #economicreconcilation ***

Le projet Cedar LNG, men√© par la Nation Haisla, est un exemple novateur de propri√©t√© autochtone dans le secteur du gaz naturel liqu√©fi√© (GNL). Skip to main content LinkedIn Articles People Learning Jobs Games Join now Sign in Paul Gruner, MBA, CPA, ICD.D‚Äôs Post Paul Gruner, MBA, CPA, ICD.D Chief Executive Officer | Certified board director | Indigenous business | Passionate about ESG | Supporter of sustainable resource extraction 2mo Report this post Over the last year Tlicho Government has been forming a relationship with Fortescue an Australian mining company that prides itself on its environmental stewardship and Indigenous partnerships. Late last year I had the opportunity to travel to Australia with the Tlicho Chiefs to tour some of Fortescue‚Äôs operations and to meet with various Indigenous groups that Fortescue works with throughout their operations. It was truly an inspiring trip with a great company that lives and breathes its values. 

Earlier this week while at the AME Roundup show Tlicho Government signed a memorandum of understanding (MOU) with Fortescue to assist in developing the Tlicho lands for future mineral development ( https://lnkd.in/gjAD8DTP ). Truly a groundbreaking moment as the nation continues to move forward and develop its economic future. I for one could not be more proud to work with this group and help build a robust economy for the region.

Integrity means doing what is right even when no one else is watching.

for Artis Biotech Integrity is the basis on which trust can be built, the yardstick that guides us in making decisions and a solid foundation for lasting relationships. In today's world where information moves at lightning speed, integrity has never been more paramount. Our character depends on it and so does our organisation‚Äôs culture.

At Artis Biotech, we think of integrity not just as a policy but as a practice too. This is seen in how we deal with our customers, partners and colleagues. We ensure that actions speak louder than words by maintaining the highest standards.

Can we have continued championing of integrity in every decision; thereby nurturing a culture of truthfulness and reliance?

Let us then join hands together with Artis Biotech to create a better world. #Integrity #Values #Ethics #Trust #Leadership 14 1 Comment Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Hessam Vali, PhD, MBA, CSSBB Driving Operational Excellence Through Innovative Technology | Lean Strategist | Empowering Digital Transformation in Manufacturing 6mo Report this post üöÄ Webinar Recap: Read Plant Fast with Gene Goodson üöÄ

Last week, we partnered with Wichita Manufacturers Association , Techam Solutions , and Optegrity Solutions, LLC to co-host a fantastic webinar led by Gene Goodson.

We were thrilled to have 90+ attendees join us both at our watch party and online! üéâ Gene shared valuable insights on how to kickstart the Lean Transformation Journey.

üí° One key highlight? The Rapid Plant Assessment tool‚Äîa quick, effective way to gauge the maturity of an operating system and create a roadmap for improvement.

Thanks to all who joined us! Let‚Äôs continue striving for excellence! üëè #LeanTransformation #ContinuousImprovement #Leadership #Manufacturing 29 1 Comment Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Danielle Orozco Cosio, PhD Co-Founder, CEO @ Ontologic | Mission-driven collaborator 9mo Edited Report this post BIO International Convention was a huge opportunity and learning experience. My key takeaways from attending for the first time last week: 

üçª Satellite events are where the real value is. We spent time on the exhibition floor and at satellite events, and hands down, made more meaningful connections at satellite events. This was because most people on the conference floor were salespeople, and we were more focused on having conversations about the science and business problems. At events run by Bullpen and several other organizations we were able to meet with decision makers, founders, and investors that gave great insights we'll be taking home with us, and will ideally lead to partnerships and deals in the coming weeks. 

üí∞ Commercialization is king. The founders and CXOs we met all had amazing scientific and technological innovations at the core of their companies, but the problems everyone was looking to solve were around money and market. How do you fund the science? How do you get it in the hands and bodies of users? How can we make the business growth align with the mission? When you're learning to be a scientist most of the emphasis is on the hard scientific problems, but once you step into the business of science, it's all about engineering human systems. 

ü§ù The best way to form relationships is in person. Ontologic was founded post-pandemic, and as a software company, most of our work can be done remotely. But when you're limited to a 1h virtual panel or a 30m zoom meeting you don't make the same personal connection that you do in person. I was so happy to run into friends coincidentally on the conference floor and have conversations I likely wouldn't have purposely sought out with people I just happened to meet at satellite events. It strengthens relationships in a very human way that isn't captured in a virtual setting, and I plan to make time for in-person social events as much as possible moving forward. 

Would love to hear others' takeaways! Ontologic 524 followers 9mo Our leadership team had such an amazing time at #BIO2024 ! We can't wait to share updates about the exciting #networking connections and #partnerships we made in San Diego last week - and are excited to do it all again Wednesday and Thursday at #FOGBoston ü§©  See you there! 37 Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Emma Johnson Life Sciences VC 10mo Edited Report this post Thanks to all that joined the closing panel session of #BioEquityEurope as the conference wrapped up by looking to the future and heard from Campbell Stewart of Novo Holdings , Therese Liechtenstein of M Ventures , Gabriela Ecco of +ND Capital and Anne Grahl of Pureos Bioventures We spoke about: 
üí∞ the role of investors
‚úÖhow we can support portfolio companies to break out from the noise, and to navigate challenges
ü§ñ the investment opportunities that are created by enabling technologies such as AI and novel research methods that are unlocking new insights into biology
üß¨ But, how investment fundamentals in biotech remain the same 
üß™ And, that the key to winning investor interest is to have breakthrough science that ignites our curiosity enough to partner with a team for the long term 125 2 Comments Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Shefali Singh Developing ‚ÄúDBMT‚Äù@Ecofunomics LLP.| Serving 1000+ students, entrepreneurs, & academicians. |R&D Specialist | Unlocking powerful insights with data analysis | GeoStrat Insights  | Crafting effective business strategies| 5mo Report this post DÕèiÕèsÕècÕèoÕèvÕèeÕèrÕè. Join us for a deep dive into ‚ÄúOptimizing the Investibility of Your Lead Program: Data-Driven Approaches for Pipeline Prioritization.‚Äù

üìÖ Date: Tuesday, June 4th from 3-4pm PT

In this session, we will explore:
üîπ Key data metrics that drive investment decisions
üîπ Strategies for prioritizing pipeline projects with high potential
üîπ Case studies and real-world applications of data-driven methodologies

As the biotech landscape becomes increasingly competitive, the ability to leverage data effectively can make all the difference. This panel will provide invaluable insights for anyone looking to enhance their program‚Äôs investibility and strategic alignment.

Whether you're a biotech entrepreneur, leader, researcher, or investor, this discussion will offer practical tools and strategies to maximize the potential of your lead program.

Looking forward to engaging with fellow experts and innovators at BIO 2024. Title: Indigenomics by DESIGN - LinkedIn
Description: May 19, 2023  ¬∑  "I love the concept of Indigenomics which talks about the actual metrics, design, and research for understanding Indigenous economic¬†...
Extracted_Text:
Indigenomics by DESIGN | Indigenomics Agree & Join LinkedIn By clicking Continue to join or sign in, you agree to LinkedIn‚Äôs User Agreement , Privacy Policy , and Cookie Policy . Skip to main content LinkedIn Articles People Learning Jobs Games Join now Sign in Indigenomics‚Äô Post Indigenomics 4,887 followers 1y Report this post "I love the concept of Indigenomics which talks about the actual metrics, design, and research for understanding Indigenous economic strength and development. 

We need to tell this new success story and outline the needs in responding to this emerging growing economy. 

Indigenomics is an economic platform to connect to the GDP, identify targets, create collective actions that support wealth generation within our communities. $100 billion Indigenous economy - that is the number we need to be paying attention to." - Clint Davis Indigenomics invites dialogue, and thought provoking insight into the possibility of the Indigenous relationship both in Canada and beyond. It explores the pathway of the threshold of the Indigenous relationship and modern economies. 

Join us next week for Indigenomics in ACTION to garner the essential tools and knowledge required to be active partners in our collective response to advancing the 100 Billion Indigenous economy.

#recruitment #reclamation #mining #indigenousbusiness #indigenomics #esg‚Ä¶ | Paul Gruner, MBA, CPA, ICD.D Agree & Join LinkedIn By clicking Continue to join or sign in, you agree to LinkedIn‚Äôs User Agreement , Privacy Policy , and Cookie Policy . Skip to main content LinkedIn Articles People Learning Jobs Games Join now Sign in Paul Gruner, MBA, CPA, ICD.D‚Äôs Post Paul Gruner, MBA, CPA, ICD.D Chief Executive Officer | Certified board director | Indigenous business | Passionate about ESG | Supporter of sustainable resource extraction 4w Report this post Successful Recruitment Drive & Information Sessions in Behchoko and Whati!
 
A huge Masi Cho to all the community members who joined us yesterday for our recruitment drive and information sessions about the employment opportunities at the Giant Mine site, as part of the upcoming Core Area Building Demolition project!
 
Your engagement and enthusiasm mean a lot, and we're thrilled to see such interest in these important employment opportunities.
 
We appreciate everyone who took time out of their Sunday afternoon and Monday evening, to attend and learn more about the project. Together, we're helping to create new opportunities and a brighter future for our communities!
 
Shout out to the team True North Environmental and Bravura Construction, for the informative and engaging presentation.

Over the next 2 years the industrial buildings onsite will be demoed and materials disposed of. 

The Tlicho Investment Corporation & Group of Companies has partnererd with True North Environmental to provide the necessary labour.  The TIC team will be providing recruitment and information sessions for the project!

Join us for an upcoming session in your community:


 *   Behchoko Culture Centre (aka Behchoko Presence Office): Sunday, February 23, 1-4 pm
 *   Whati Culture Centre: Monday, February 24, 4-7:30 pm
 *   Yellowknife TIC Office/Boardroom: Tuesday, February 25,  5-8 pm

Here's what you can expect at each location:

Behchok«´ÃÄ:
1-2 pm - Doors Open/Welcome
2-3 pm - Presentation/Employment Opportunities
3-4 pm - Employment Application Support

What√¨:

6-7:30 pm - Employment Application Support

Yellowknife
5-6 pm - Doors Open/Welcome
6-7 pm - Presentation/Employment Opportunities
7-8 pm - Employment Application Support

Please spread the good word.  There are 60 positions we are looking to fill which can lead to other exciting opportunities on the project over the next 10 years. #reclamation #mining #indigenomics #indigenousbusiness #esg #empowerment #demolition #nwt #yellowknife #tlicho 160 3 Comments Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter Jesse Cody Owner at Red Spade Ent. $2M+ anticipated for one weekend is truly impressive. #Indigenomics #IndigenousEconomy #FirstNationEconomicImpact City of Timmins 4,480 followers 1mo #mushcup is back ... and Timmins is ready!

Today until Sunday, the ice is booked for 136 hockey games. All part of the 16th Annual Mushkegowuk Cup. Welcome teams, players, families, and hockey fans. 

Events like the Mushkegowuk Cup help northern communities thrive. One long weekend of great hockey is expected to bring in over $2 million to support local hotels, restaurants, and retailers. Amazing!

Meegwetch. Have fun! #timmins #northernontario #hockey #matchup #slapshot #ice 43 1 Comment Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter Jim A. Indigenomics IMPACT 2025 will feature key conversations on:
Corporate Reconciliation Action Planning ‚Äì Meaningful partnerships for real impact
Indigenous Conservation Economy ‚Äì Aligning economic growth with sustainability
Indigenous Infrastructure ‚Äì Investing in community-driven solutions
Indigenous Innovation ‚Äì Redefining business, technology, and entrepreneurship.

Speakers: Daphne Kay , Sr. Policy Analyst Assembly of First Nations Priya Bala-Miller PhD , Managing Director of the Nature Investment Hub Catherine Pennington Director, Indigenous Advisory Services / Global Infrastructure Advisory KPMG Canada Marissa Nobauer Director, Reconciliation, Community Engagement and External Relations TELUS Deanna Lewis Cultural and Gender Safety Awareness, KC-Kalkalilh Communications Pat Fosbery CEO, All Nations Trust Co Joel Neustaeter Vice President, Indigenous Banking, British Columbia & Yukon, BMO James Delorme CEO, Indigenous Infrastructure Fund Join leaders shaping the Indigenous economy. Skip to main content LinkedIn Articles People Learning Jobs Games Join now Sign in Paul Gruner, MBA, CPA, ICD.D‚Äôs Post Paul Gruner, MBA, CPA, ICD.D Chief Executive Officer | Certified board director | Indigenous business | Passionate about ESG | Supporter of sustainable resource extraction 2w Report this post Finishing up a busy week at the Prospectors and Development Association of Canada (PDAC) conference in Toronto. Had the opportunity to connect with lots of colleagues while proudly representing Tlicho Investment Corporation & Group of Companies with members of the team and Tlicho leadership. 

Several of us sat down on a panel discussing a decarbonized mining world. Some great examples from across the North for both active and exploration mining project all of which had significant Indigenous involvement. 

It was announced that I have joined the board for Kingfisher Metals Corp. Excited to join Dustin Perry, P.Geo. and the team in their journey to develop the next world class properties in the golden triangle.  They have a great vision and are focused on creating value for the Tahltan nation on the lands that they operate on. 

Hope everyone had an excellent PDAC as well!!! #mining #exploration #indigenousbusiness #indigenomics #esg #community #criticalminerals #nwt #yellowknife 97 3 Comments Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter Elizabeth Fillatre Miller Vice President Environment and Social Responsibility (ESR) at Seabridge Gold Inc. 2w Report this comment Was great to see you Paul! Description: 6 days ago  ¬∑  ... indigenomics #fashion #jewelry #nwt #yellowknife # ... #naturaldiamonds #mining #esg #indigenousbusiness #indigenomics #fashion #jewelry #nwt #¬†...
Extracted_Text:
#naturaldiamonds #mining #esg #indigenousbusiness #indigenomics #fashion‚Ä¶ | Paul Gruner, MBA, CPA, ICD.D | 28 comments Agree & Join LinkedIn By clicking Continue to join or sign in, you agree to LinkedIn‚Äôs User Agreement , Privacy Policy , and Cookie Policy . Skip to main content LinkedIn Articles People Learning Jobs Games Join now Sign in Paul Gruner, MBA, CPA, ICD.D‚Äôs Post Paul Gruner, MBA, CPA, ICD.D Chief Executive Officer | Certified board director | Indigenous business | Passionate about ESG | Supporter of sustainable resource extraction 6d Edited Report this post I had the opportunity to present with my fellow panelists at Canada House in London yesterday on the Canadian natural diamond industry.

Some of the key points included:

- The co-management of mining within the NWT between Indigenous groups, government and industry. 

- The best practices of socio-economic agreements and Impact Benefit Agreements that have resulted in meaningful employment, capacity building, economic opportunity and infrastructure. 

- The planned reclamation of the mines before they are even started ensuring that there isn‚Äôt a negative legacy at the end of mine life. 

- How the mining sector has impacted Indigenous communities both positively and negatively. 

- The eye watering experiences of Lily James and her team experiencing -50 for the first time (full disclosure it‚Äôs still darn cold for us northerners as well. 

Thank you for the invite to participate Natural Diamond Council and to Raluca Anghel for organizing. Amazing event. #naturaldiamonds #mining #esg #indigenousbusiness #indigenomics #fashion #jewelry #nwt #yellowknife #canada 357 28 Comments Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter Wendy Larson Leader in Digital Transformation / Empowering companies to outpace the competition through digital transformation 6d Report this comment Such a great opportunity for you Paul Gruner, MBA, CPA, ICD.D ! Great picture of everyone as well! Like Reply 1¬†Reaction 2¬†Reactions John Henderson CEO at ClearPath Advisory 6d Report this comment Nicely done ! Like Reply 1¬†Reaction Allison Rippin Armstrong Self Employed at ARA Environmental Consulting Services Ltd. 6d Report this comment It was an incredible event and evening. You are an excellent ambassador for Canada Paul! You represented the NWT beautifully! Like Reply 4¬†Reactions 5¬†Reactions Tara Marchiori Manager, Communities & Social Performance at Rio Tinto Diavik Diamond Mine 5d Report this comment So wonderful to see the representatives from the NWT! Thanks for sharing! Like Reply 1¬†Reaction 2¬†Reactions David Perry Global Executive Recruiter | C-Suite Niches: Construction, Real Estate & Tech Leadership | $420M+ in Cross-Continental Deals | Keynote Speaker | Expert Witness | Authored 9 books | NEW BOOK 'Revolutions Need Leaders' 1d Report this comment Let‚Äôs Back Canadian Tech with More Than Words

If we want a truly sovereign innovation economy, we need bold policy‚Äînot just polished partnerships.

That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm supporting CanFlowthrough.com ‚Äîa national campaign to extend flow-through shares to Canada‚Äôs technology sector.

Flow-through shares have helped build Canada‚Äôs mining and energy industries for decades. It‚Äôs time to give our digital economy the same chance.

If you‚Äôre a founder, investor, policymaker, or just someone who believes in keeping Canadian innovation in Canadian hands, visit www.canflowthrough.com and add your voice.

Because revolutions need fuel‚Äîand Canadian tech needs a fair shot. Like Reply 1¬†Reaction William A. Advancing #IndigenousEconomy & IndigenomicsAI #indigenousAI 2mo The Indigenomics Institute is excited to launch  Indigenomics 50-  an ambitious challenge designed to guide 50 leading companies and organizations through the Indigenomics LEGO DESIGN Reconciliation Action Planning Sessions in 2025. This initiative leverages an innovative, interactive approach that integrates the principles of collaboration, creativity, and accountability to support organizations in embedding reconciliation outcomes into their core strategies.

Kicking off in Vancouver on April 7th, the sessions will take place throughout the year across the country. Participants will co-create actionable reconciliation plans that align with economic inclusion, cultural respect, and partnerships with Indigenous communities. 

Be part of reconciliation-driven innovation! 

Email info@indigenomics.com to register. #cheekbone #indigenomics #yukonsoaps #ravenreads #indigenousbox‚Ä¶ | June Anthony-Reeves Agree & Join LinkedIn By clicking Continue to join or sign in, you agree to LinkedIn‚Äôs User Agreement , Privacy Policy , and Cookie Policy . Skip to main content LinkedIn Articles People Learning Jobs Games Join now Sign in June Anthony-Reeves‚Äô Post June Anthony-Reeves Founder | Sr. Herbalist -                                                                                                                   
Botanical Products & Gift Boxes 1y Report this post PEER MENTORING IN BUSINESS!

I've had the honor of learning from very strong and successful women and men in business!  

It didn't take me long to realize that I could not and should not attempt to manage, operate or grow my business on my own!  I needed to learn from the business women and men who had done this before me!  I learned very quickly that we were not in competition, and so many successful business people were willing to help me grow my business!

I learned from several business books published by successful business women and I shamelessly support the writings and teachings from  Arlene Dickinson, Venture Communications.  I had chats with the successful beauty brand #Cheekbone creator, Jen Harper, and successful female leaders from #indigenomics , Carol Anne Hilton; #yukonsoaps , #RavenReads , #Indigenousbox , #BearsLairTV creator Geena Jackson and so many more peer mentors and successful business people across Canada.  I am so grateful!!

I also have a business coach who helps me  to  find resources for the growth  and management of my business.

Description: Oct 23, 2024  ¬∑  CEO/ Founder of the #Indigenomics Institute, the Global Centre of Indigenomics & the Global Indigenous Technology House- Entrepreneur¬†...
Extracted_Text:
#indigenomics | Carol Anne Hilton, MBA, ICD.D Agree & Join LinkedIn By clicking Continue to join or sign in, you agree to LinkedIn‚Äôs User Agreement , Privacy Policy , and Cookie Policy . Skip to main content LinkedIn Articles People Learning Jobs Games Join now Sign in Carol Anne Hilton, MBA, ICD.D‚Äôs Post Carol Anne Hilton, MBA, ICD.D Founder of #Indigenomics movement- Indigenomics Institute, Global Centre Indigenomics & Indigenous Technology House. Entrepreneur, Author x 2, Speaker, Advisor. Advancing #IndigenousEconomy & IndigenomicsAI #indigenousAI 5mo Report this post #indigenomics Olthuis, Kleer, Townshend LLP 1,389 followers 5mo In our latest blog post 'Good corporate governance must take into account Aboriginal rights,' authors Nick Kennedy , Jaclyn McNamara and Thadsha Chandrakumaran highlight the Supreme Court's recent refusal to hear the appeal in¬†Thomas v Rio Tinto Alcan Inc, 2024 BCCA 62 [Saik‚Äôuz]. In¬†Saik‚Äôuz, the British Columbia Court of Appeal found that Aboriginal fishing rights were capable of grounding a claim in nuisance against a private entity, but that Rio Tinto Alcan Inc. (‚ÄúRio Tinto‚Äù) had a complete defence because its actions were authorized by statute.

The Supreme Court‚Äôs refusal to hear this appeal was a missed opportunity to advance reconciliation. The Court could have done so by abolishing the statutory authorization defence for infringements of Aboriginal rights and title, thereby allocating a greater share of the risk of liability onto private entities. If the Supreme Court had taken this bold step, it would have increased the likelihood of these claims being settled, either by the private entities themselves or by the Crown under pressure from the private sector.

Title: #indigenomics #scholarshiprecipients #indigenousexcellence‚Ä¶
Description: Jan 17, 2025  ¬∑  We are thrilled to introduce Lance B., a recipient of the 2024 Indigenomics Scholarship. Lance Black is Anicinape from Apitipi Anicinapek Nation in Ontario.
Extracted_Text:
#indigenomics #scholarshiprecipients #indigenousexcellence‚Ä¶ | Indigenomics | 11 comments Agree & Join LinkedIn By clicking Continue to join or sign in, you agree to LinkedIn‚Äôs User Agreement , Privacy Policy , and Cookie Policy . Skip to main content LinkedIn Articles People Learning Jobs Games Join now Sign in Indigenomics‚Äô Post Indigenomics 4,887 followers 2mo Edited Report this post Celebrating Indigenomics Scholarship Recipient: Lance Black! 

We are thrilled to introduce Lance B. , a recipient of the 2024 Indigenomics Scholarship. Lance Black is Anicinape from Apitipi Anicinapek Nation in Ontario. He is the Director of Negotiations and Contract Management for his Nation and an MBA candidate at Ivey Business School. Lance represents his community in mining negotiations while also leading Apitipi Resources Inc. as President. By night, Lance is a DJ and has a passion for underground dance music playing Indigenous events on occasion.

We are proud to celebrate Lance‚Äôs inspiring journey as he continues to pave the way for economic reconciliation and community empowerment. #Indigenomics #ScholarshipRecipients #IndigenousExcellence #Indigenomicsscholarships 101 11 Comments Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter Gilles Laderoute Real estate investor, Chair of Time To Lead Christian Concert committee, Former BRM Mayor and Councillor, Entrepreneur,  Father, Grandfather and Christian 1mo Report this comment Congratulations Lance!!

Hilarious 

‚Ä¢ $360,000 to study Big Things such as the Ohakune Carrot, with a focus on ‚Äúa critical gaze to the privileging of PƒÅkehƒÅ-centred narratives in current research on roadside ‚ÄúBig Things‚Äù and ‚ÄúWeaving together feminist, participatory, and filmic geographies, this project seeks to re-centre alternative stories currently hidden in the Big Things‚Äô shadows‚Äú

‚Ä¢ $360,000 to collect disabled indigenous stories about climate change with ‚Äúestablishing how such stories resist ableist narratives and theorise and advance disability-centred ways of creating sustainable and just environmental futures.‚Äú

‚Ä¢$861,000 to explore dark nudges and sludge on social media in relation to advertising alcohol.

There is still work to be done clearing the progressive idiots who make these stupid decisions out of funding organisations such as Marsden Fund and Foundation North to name a few. 55 39 Comments Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Carol Anne Hilton, MBA, ICD.D Founder of #Indigenomics movement- Indigenomics Institute, Global Centre Indigenomics & Indigenous Technology House. Discover 13 streams of content, each reflecting the 13 moons, and engage with 4 dynamic stages mirroring the 4 directions. Don't miss out on this opportunity to be part of a new economic narrative rooted in the natural world. 

Join us for this inaugural event, a 24-hour journey guided by voices from Indigenous communities worldwide.

Learn more and register here: https://lnkd.in/gJskduZ9 #Indigenomics #JoinTheConversation #IndigenomicsNOW #IndigenousVoices #NaturalWorldEconomics #24HourForum #IndigenomicsNOW üåøüåé 30 2 Comments Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Rainbow Rare Earths 2,393 followers 6mo Report this post Rainbow Rare Earths CEO, George Bennett spoke to Stephen Gunnion at Proactive about the update to the MRE as announced this morning, which extends the mine life t from 14 years to 16 years, with the resource increasing to 35 million tonnes. 

With a cut-off grade of 2.2%, the project will be able to process nearly all the resource, extracting maximum value from the four critical rare earths in the basket ‚Äîneodymium, praseodymium, dysprosium, and terbium‚Äîused in consumer electronics, #electricvehicles , and #windturbines , in addition to other recoverable REEs which may hold future value: samarium, europium, gadolinium, lanthanum and cerium.

Even in a lower pricing environment, the Rainbow holds a competitive advantage as a low-cost producer, given the nature of the asset. Rainbow will release a Definitive Feasibility Study (DFS) by early 2025, with a preliminary update expected in November 2024. üåç Title: "Roots and Shifts: The Urhobo People and the Coming of Oil"

Stay tuned for the next series! #UrhoboHeritage #BlackGold #OilImpact #ResearchJournal #CommunityEngagement #Warri #Radiostation 4 Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Keith Mawanda Research Officer in business and marketing at Internetyo Global Solutions (IGS) Ltd. 2mo Report this post Congratulations on the release of the first part of The Paradox of Black Gold: Oil Exploration and its Impact on the Urhobo People. This research journal promises to be an enlightening exploration of the complex intersection of culture, environment, and economic change, which is so often overlooked in discussions surrounding oil exploration.
The Urhobo people's heritage and history, deeply entwined with their ancestral lands, set a powerful backdrop for the narrative of transformation brought about by the discovery and exploitation of oil. Your work sheds light on how such seismic changes affect not only the environment but also the social fabric, cultural identity, and livelihoods of the community.
The title "Roots and Shifts: The Urhobo People and the Coming of Oil" poignantly captures the essence of this transformation ‚Äî the roots representing the cultural and environmental richness of the community, while the shifts signify the profound disruptions and challenges brought by the arrival of the oil industry.
Your approach to chronicling this history is invaluable, and I look forward to diving deeper into how these changes have reshaped the lives of the Urhobo people. It is crucial to explore such topics from a local, grassroots perspective to create a more holistic understanding of the effects of resource extraction on indigenous communities. This journal will no doubt foster greater dialogue around responsible resource management and community engagement.
I eagerly await the next installment of this series, and I commend your commitment to highlighting the voices of those who are often left out of mainstream discussions about oil and development. #OilImpact #CulturalHeritage #EnvironmentalChange #CommunityResearch #IndigenousRights #SustainableDevelopment #BlackGold Ogheneruemu Siemuri Graduate || Environmentalist || Ex- Intern at Tudaka Analytical Limited || Editor || Teacher || Fashion Designer|| Baker || Ecowriter ||Student at Delta State University, Nigeria 2mo Edited üì¢ New Research Journal Alert!
