If we break down the terms, then Makar means Capricorn and
Sankranti means enty of the sun. Hence Makar Sankrati simply means entry of the sun into the zodiac sign of Capricorn. This is the day when the sun begins its northward journey in the sky, from the Tropic of Capricorn to the Tropic of cancer.
 This celestial event has a profound effect on the biosphere and the
environment, due to the changes in the Earth's energy dynamics. 
This shift results in longer days, higher temperatures, and a boost in
photosynthesis, which supports plant growth and enhances
agricultural cycles. It also influences animal behavior, triggering migration patterns in birds and awakening hibernating species. The warming effect
accelerates biological activity across ecosystems, from forests to
grasslands.
Beyond ecological impacts, the increase in sunlight benefits human
well-being by enhancing mood and energy levels, contributing to
social and cultural celebrations like Makar Sankranti, Pongal, Bihu and Lohri.
One festival, so many names !
Makar Sankranti will begin on 14 th January at 9.03 AM IST.
Greetings and best wishes for the auspicious festival. #MakarSankranti #CapricornSun #SolarJourney #WinterSolstice #EnergyShift #BiosphereImpact #EcologicalChange #LongerDays #AgricultureCycle #PhotosynthesisBoost #NatureAwakening #MigrationPatterns #HumanWellBeing #CulturalCelebrations #FestivalsOfIndia #Pongal #Bihu #FestivalSeason #NewBeginnings #SolarEvent #MakarSankranti2025 #AuspiciousOccasions #GoodVibes ‚Ä¶more Makar Sankranti: The Scientific basis https://www.youtube.com/ 19 Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Dr Angela C Meyers Author, Coach, Consultant. Reducing Human Suffering. Enhancing Human Thriving. 3mo Edited Report this post Last month, I hosted an international Polymath Retreat in Corfu, Greece with brilliant minds from Canada, the USA, Brazil, England, Switzerland, and the Netherlands‚Äîa true global gathering. 

We had a diverse, well-balanced group, with roughly half male and half female participants. 

Our mission was bold: to begin tackling some of the world‚Äôs most pressing global issues.

Did we figure out how to save the world in a three-hour workshop? No. But did we start an important conversation and document our insights? Absolutely. And will we build from this foundation? Without question. 

This is just the beginning, but it‚Äôs a necessary start.

Humanity must self-organize differently if we are to solve the polycrisis on a global scale. 

Who can rise to the challenge? Polymaths‚Äîthe systems thinkers, the big-picture problem solvers.

Murphy Indigenomics 1w Report this post Attending this year‚Äôs RES filled me with so much joy, pride, and inspiration. It was an honor to celebrate and connect with esteemed tribal economic professionals and friends. The conversations, collaborations, and shared vision for strengthening Indigenous economies continue to fuel my passion for this work. Grateful for the moments of learning, laughter, and empowerment‚Äîhere‚Äôs to building a future rooted in sovereignty and prosperity!
Note-to-self: take more photos üòâ #RES2025 #TribalEconomicDevelopment #Indigenomics The National Center For American Indian Enterprise Development 57 2 Comments Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter Dr. Alisha L. Murphy Indigenomics 1w Report this comment After a few days to process and reflect, I am even more grateful to have attended RES this year. ‚ú®Ô∏è

I first attended RES as a student, and it was transformative. Then, I hustled to secure travel grants each year because my degree programs lacked the voices and stories of tribal communities in economic development and social work. RES filled that gap.ü§ì

This year, I had the honor of meeting around 15 first-time attendees‚Äîthanking them for coming like I was part of NCAIED. I was genuinely proud to meet them and excited for the connections they will build among 4,600+ attendees.üòÑ

Skip to main content LinkedIn Articles People Learning Jobs Games Join now Sign in Michelle Laviolette‚Äôs Post Michelle Laviolette Director, Indigenous Banking Strategy at Vancity 1y Report this post Proud that Vancity‚Äôs partnership with Indigenomics supports incredible talent development! Congratulations Caleb! Carol Anne Hilton, MBA, ICD.D Founder of #Indigenomics movement- Indigenomics Institute, Global Centre Indigenomics & Indigenous Technology House. Entrepreneur, Author x 2, Speaker, Advisor. Advancing #IndigenousEconomy & IndigenomicsAI #indigenousAI 1y Congratulations to Caleb Maurice- the  Indigenomics DESIGN 2023 Scholarship Recipient!
The Indigenomics Institute Scholarship was established to honour the resilience of Indigenous people who were systematically denied a seat at the economic table of this country.
The scholarship goes to Indigenous students enrolled in Business, Commerce or Finance academic programs across Canada in either Bachelor or Masters Programs.
Proceeds from revenues from the Indigenomics Store, comprised of t-shirts, mugs, candles, jewelry and tea and other products will go towards the distribution of annual Indigenomics scholarships.
This is the 5th scholarship that has been awarded since 2022 and the Indigenomics Institute is pleased to welcome Vancity as a partner to the Indigenomics Scholarship. #Indigenomics #indigenouseconomy #100billion 23 1 Comment Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter Gil Yaron Managing Director, Circular Innovation 1y Report this comment Way to go Caleb Maurice !!! Title: Paul Gruner, MBA, CPA, ICD.D on LinkedIn
Description: Oct 12, 2023  ¬∑  #esg #business #criticalminerals #indigenomics #indigenousbusiness #community #prosperity. No alternative text description for this image. 84¬†...
Extracted_Text:
#esg #business #criticalminerals #indigenomics #indigenousbusiness‚Ä¶ | Paul Gruner, MBA, CPA, ICD.D Agree & Join LinkedIn By clicking Continue to join or sign in, you agree to LinkedIn‚Äôs User Agreement , Privacy Policy , and Cookie Policy . Skip to main content LinkedIn Articles People Learning Jobs Games Join now Sign in Paul Gruner, MBA, CPA, ICD.D‚Äôs Post Paul Gruner, MBA, CPA, ICD.D Chief Executive Officer | Certified board director | Indigenous business | Passionate about ESG | Supporter of sustainable resource extraction 1y Edited Report this post Enjoyed presenting with Rob McPhee at the Business Council of British Columbia Business Forum. 

We kept it short and punchy focussing on:

- The TNDC journey which requires a strong team, supportive community and industry /government support. 

- A drive towards a decarbonzed mining jurisdiction which will be the first Tier 1 carbon neutral mining jurisdiction in Canada.

- The need for Government and Industry to continue investing in Indigenous communities and businesses and the areas they reside in. Indigenous communities are often the gatekeepers for projects to move forward. Bring Indigenous communities into the opportunities in a meaningful way as true partners. 

Thank you again for Tahltan Nation Development Corporation (TNDC) to present. Great crowd!!! #esg #business #criticalminerals #indigenomics #indigenousbusiness #community #prosperity 84 2 Comments Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter Layne Tucker Indigenous Founder ECHORFID/PIPETALKER 2011 Founder Prostar Technologies. Extracted_Text:
Indigenomics NOW: A guide to interconnectedness | Carol Anne Hilton, MBA, ICD.D posted on the topic | LinkedIn Agree & Join LinkedIn By clicking Continue to join or sign in, you agree to LinkedIn‚Äôs User Agreement , Privacy Policy , and Cookie Policy . Skip to main content LinkedIn Articles People Learning Jobs Games Join now Sign in Carol Anne Hilton, MBA, ICD.D‚Äôs Post Carol Anne Hilton, MBA, ICD.D Founder of #Indigenomics movement- Indigenomics Institute, Global Centre Indigenomics & Indigenous Technology House. Entrepreneur, Author x 2, Speaker, Advisor. Advancing #IndigenousEconomy & IndigenomicsAI #indigenousAI 1y Report this post Indigenomics NOW draws inspiration from the powerful Nuu-chah-nulth concept of ‚Äútsawalk," which translates to "one." This profound principle reminds us that all living beings, from humans and animals to the very plants that sustain us, are fundamentally interconnected, forming a single, harmonious whole.

Within the framework of Indigenomics, "tsawalk" becomes a guiding light, to acknowledge the intrinsic interconnectedness of our economic systems with the natural world. Indigenomics NOW is designed to reflect the natural world and serves to advance an economic narrative that is shaped by the natural world.

Indigenomics NOW serves as a powerful platform to translate this philosophy into action. November 14th ,2024. Registration opens soon.

#energytransition #cleanenergy #indigenomics #gridmodernization‚Ä¶ | Don Richardson Agree & Join LinkedIn By clicking Continue to join or sign in, you agree to LinkedIn‚Äôs User Agreement , Privacy Policy , and Cookie Policy . Skip to main content LinkedIn Articles People Learning Jobs Games Join now Sign in Don Richardson‚Äôs Post Don Richardson CEO @ Minogi Corp., Interim CEO @ Noozhoo Nokiiyan LP | Spearheading First Nation Investments 3mo Report this post This week I had the honour to fill in for Chief Kelly LaRocca of the Mississaugas of Scugog Island First Nation (MSIFN) in a panel discussion titled "Energy Grids and Storage ‚Äì Investing in a Cleaner Future" sponsored by the Globe and Mail in partnership with Indigenous Clean Energy (ICE). 

Ontario's energy project growth is happening at a pace we have never seen, and First Nations like MSIFN are at the epicenter. Moderator Matt McClearn from the Globe and Mail's Energy, Natural Resources and Environment Team focused on the challenges and solutions for the energy transition, including the rapid growth of First Nation investments and co-development of significant projects. I am proud of our work at MSIFN through Minogi to accelerate clean energy investments with our First Nation and private sector partners with new and creative investment solutions.

We had an informative discussion with co-panelists Jason Rioux , Chief Development Officer of NRStor Inc. , and Simmer Anand , Senior Manager, Indigenous Relations¬†of Hydro One . Thanks to the Globe and Mail ( Lisa Wichmann ) and ICE ( James Jenkins ) for creating the stage for this important conversation. #EnergyTransition #CleanEnergy #Indigenomics #GridModernization #IndigenousPartnerships #Sustainability The Globe and Mail Events 1,851 followers 3mo PANEL | Energy Grids and Storage ‚Äì Investing in a cleaner future, moderated by Matt McClearn , Data Reporter, The Globe and Mail Don Richardson , CEO, Minogi (joining virtually) Jason Rioux , Chief Development Officer, NRStor Inc. Simmer Anand , Senior Manager of Indigenous Relations, Hydro One #GlobeGathering 52 3 Comments Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter Dave Mowat 3mo Report this comment Getting out on the front end of sustainable energy development and innovation is key in these dynamic times. And as First Nations people and communities our place in this landscape is an important and necessary objective.  A research hub Don, I think at the FN level, to feed into this industry is another, I think, worthy endeavour. State of the art, sustainable energy innovation centre/hub! By swapping out their old engines for the cutting-edge Waukesha VHP Series Five engines from INNIO. These engines not only reduce methane emissions by 90% but also cut CO2e intensity by 20%! üå±üí®

The best part? Enstor didn't have to choose between profitability and sustainability. The reUp program allowed them to upgrade to the latest tech while reusing existing infrastructure, making it a win-win for both the environment and their bottom line. üí°üí∞

This project is a shining example of how innovation and sustainability can go hand in hand. Kudos to Enstor for leading the way! üëè #WaukeshaEngines #EnergyInnovation #SustainableSolutions #CarbonNeutral #OilAndGas #ClimateAction üåçüîãüí°

What do you think? üòä 13 Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in John Feddersen Founder & CEO, Aurora Energy Research Limited 11mo Edited Report this post Excellent video Henry Schmandt ! A little technical, but I wholeheartedly recommend for anyone investing in nodal markets. 

The Aurora Energy Research team‚Äôs development of capabilities for flow-based nodal analysis provides an important example of ‚Äúuseful complexity‚Äù in power modelling.

George Box famously said: ‚Äúall models are wrong, but some are useful‚Äù.

As a modelling company first and foremost, perhaps the most important (and often hardest) strategic decision for Aurora is deciding how much complexity to incorporate into our models.

Complexity in models is expensive: it increases solve time and compute; and takes time and deep expertise to code and debug. 

For many years and in many markets, Aurora have explored various ways to model nodal pricing in power markets (e.g. extrapolation based on history; structural statistical relationships) but none of them provide the flexibility and richness of Fundamental Security Constrained Economic Dispatch (SCED) modelling. 

A really great explanation here of why we go to the effort to do it, and why it is so important for anyone investing in nodal markets. Powerstar, a leading energy solutions provider, turned to Crowcon to address the risks of thermal runaway in battery storage systems - a critical challenge for protecting life-critical services.

By integrating Crowcon‚Äôs gas detection technology, Powerstar now ensures the safe and reliable operation of their systems, providing essential power to healthcare, data centres, and more. ‚ÄúCrowcon‚Äôs technology helped to solve a major problem with our system: the risk around battery storage systems is that they can go into thermal runaway.‚Äù- Solon Mardapittas

We are deeply grateful to Earnscliffe Strategies and Kaiser & Partners for their incredible support as Platinum Sponsors for Indigenomics on BAY STREET. A special thank you to Mary Anne Carter , Principal at Earnscliffe, for moderating the Capitalization of the Indigenous Economy plenary session and delivering opening remarks on Day 2.

Your collaboration and commitment are invaluable as we work together to advance economic reconciliation. #Indigenomics #EarnscliffeStrategies #KaiserAndPartners #EconomicReconciliation #IndigenousEconomy #CorporatePartnership 19 Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in More Relevant Posts Michael Ferreyros Research Services Program Manager | Executive MBA 6mo Report this post I was excited to dig into this one!

In an era where innovation is the cornerstone of progress, the conversation around decentralized science (DeSci) and decentralized autonomous organizations (DAOs) in longevity biotech is timely and vital. 

The recent Longevity+DeSci Summit in NYC, hosted by Lifespan.io , was a pivotal event that presented a fascinating panel discussion on the intersection of decentralized science (DeSci) and autonomous organizations in longevity biotech. 

The summit featured an impressive lineup of panelists. These thought leaders each brought a unique perspective and expertise, contributing to our understanding of how DeSci and DAOs can revolutionize our engagement with longevity biotech. The synergy between traditional biotech and emerging decentralized frameworks will pave the way for unprecedented breakthroughs. 

As leaders and innovators, it's crucial that we stay ahead of these conversations and actively leverage them to foster growth and collaboration in the biotech sphere. I highly recommend watching the entire discussion for insights into the future of longevity and how we can collectively push the boundaries of science and technology. 

You can access the video here: https://lnkd.in/e8T665Zz . Lifespan.io Longevity News 8,360 followers 6mo Panel discussion entitled "The Role of DeSci and DAOs in Engaging the World in Longevity Biotech" at the Longevity+DeSci Summit NYC (EARD 2023) hosted by Lifespan.io (Lifespan Extension Advocacy Foundation) Panel speakers include: Keith Comito -President and Co-founder of Lifespan.io Jelani Clarke Ph.D. Clarke, Ph.D.
-Core Leadership at DeSci World Azeem Khan -Head of Impact at Gitcoin Eleanor Davies  
-Longevity Dealflow at VitaDAO Natasha Vita-More, PhD, MPhil, MSc - 1st Vita-More, Ph.D.
-Longevity and Evolution Expert at Digital University Chauncey St. John -Founder of Angel Protocol

We are deeply grateful to the First Nations Major Projects Coalition for their support as the Content Sponsor of the Indigenous Wealth Building session at Indigenomics on BAY STREET. 

This important session invited dialogue on how Indigenous trusts and investment strategies have evolved significantly over the last 50 years. Through increasing settlement values and innovative strategies, trusts and investments have become powerful tools for driving economic development and supporting social programming in Indigenous communities. 

Learn more about FNMPC here: https://fnmpc.ca/ #Indigenomics #FirstNationsMajorProjectsCoalition #IndigenousWealth #EconomicReconciliation #IndigenousEconomy #CorporatePartnership 14 Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Indigenomics 4,887 followers 10mo Report this post The expression of Indigenous value, of value creation and the distribution of wealth is expressed through ceremony and relationships within Indigenous reality. 

For thousands of years, wealth has been expressed through giving, the transaction, the distribution through ceremony and based upon the quality of recognition of relationship and connection to each other, to our environment, and to resources with respect for life at the heart of both the economy and ceremony. 

This is Indigenomics.

The technology behind developing a Universal Oxygen carrier is proceeding.  
Reminding people that animal trials showed no increase in respiration despite taking out blood.  There's a reason why we can only donate 1 pint of blood because if you took out more the heart would have to pump harder to get same amount oxygen to the parts of the body with less blood volume.  That means you have to circulate a lower volume of blood more times to keep the same output.  Since respiration didn't increase its reasonable to conclude that the animals got oxygen from the molecule.

We are thrilled to introduce Lance B. , a recipient of the 2024 Indigenomics Scholarship. Lance Black is Anicinape from Apitipi Anicinapek Nation in Ontario. He is the Director of Negotiations and Contract Management for his Nation and an MBA candidate at Ivey Business School. Lance represents his community in mining negotiations while also leading Apitipi Resources Inc. as President. By night, Lance is a DJ and has a passion for underground dance music playing Indigenous events on occasion.

With a cut-off grade of 2.2%, the project will be able to process nearly all the resource, extracting maximum value from the four critical rare earths in the basket ‚Äîneodymium, praseodymium, dysprosium, and terbium‚Äîused in consumer electronics, #electricvehicles , and #windturbines , in addition to other recoverable REEs which may hold future value: samarium, europium, gadolinium, lanthanum and cerium.

üéâ We‚Äôre thrilled to announce the release of the first part of our series, "The Paradox of Black Gold: Oil Exploration and its Impact on the Urhobo People."

This research journal promises to be an enlightening exploration of the complex intersection of culture, environment, and economic change, which is so often overlooked in discussions surrounding oil exploration.
The Urhobo people's heritage and history, deeply entwined with their ancestral lands, set a powerful backdrop for the narrative of transformation brought about by the discovery and exploitation of oil. Your work sheds light on how such seismic changes affect not only the environment but also the social fabric, cultural identity, and livelihoods of the community.
The title "Roots and Shifts: The Urhobo People and the Coming of Oil" poignantly captures the essence of this transformation ‚Äî the roots representing the cultural and environmental richness of the community, while the shifts signify the profound disruptions and challenges brought by the arrival of the oil industry.
Your approach to chronicling this history is invaluable, and I look forward to diving deeper into how these changes have reshaped the lives of the Urhobo people. It is crucial to explore such topics from a local, grassroots perspective to create a more holistic understanding of the effects of resource extraction on indigenous communities. This journal will no doubt foster greater dialogue around responsible resource management and community engagement.
I eagerly await the next installment of this series, and I commend your commitment to highlighting the voices of those who are often left out of mainstream discussions about oil and development. #OilImpact #CulturalHeritage #EnvironmentalChange #CommunityResearch #IndigenousRights #SustainableDevelopment #BlackGold Ogheneruemu Siemuri Graduate || Environmentalist || Ex- Intern at Tudaka Analytical Limited || Editor || Teacher || Fashion Designer|| Baker || Ecowriter ||Student at Delta State University, Nigeria 2mo Edited üì¢ New Research Journal Alert!

Csak √≥vatosan! üòè‚òùÔ∏è / #csal√°dfa #csal√°dt√∂rt√©net #hungary #genealogy https://www.youtube.com/ 1 Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Sujata Sharma 2mo Report this post The Scientific Basis of Makar Sankranti.

If we break down the terms, then Makar means Capricorn and
Sankranti means enty of the sun. Hence Makar Sankrati simply means entry of the sun into the zodiac sign of Capricorn. This is the day when the sun begins its northward journey in the sky, from the Tropic of Capricorn to the Tropic of cancer.
 This celestial event has a profound effect on the biosphere and the
environment, due to the changes in the Earth's energy dynamics. 
This shift results in longer days, higher temperatures, and a boost in
photosynthesis, which supports plant growth and enhances
agricultural cycles. It also influences animal behavior, triggering migration patterns in birds and awakening hibernating species. The warming effect
accelerates biological activity across ecosystems, from forests to
grasslands.
Beyond ecological impacts, the increase in sunlight benefits human
well-being by enhancing mood and energy levels, contributing to
social and cultural celebrations like Makar Sankranti, Pongal, Bihu and Lohri.
One festival, so many names !
Makar Sankranti will begin on 14 th January at 9.03 AM IST.
Greetings and best wishes for the auspicious festival. #MakarSankranti #CapricornSun #SolarJourney #WinterSolstice #EnergyShift #BiosphereImpact #EcologicalChange #LongerDays #AgricultureCycle #PhotosynthesisBoost #NatureAwakening #MigrationPatterns #HumanWellBeing #CulturalCelebrations #FestivalsOfIndia #Pongal #Bihu #FestivalSeason #NewBeginnings #SolarEvent #MakarSankranti2025 #AuspiciousOccasions #GoodVibes ‚Ä¶more Makar Sankranti: The Scientific basis https://www.youtube.com/ 19 Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Dr Angela C Meyers Author, Coach, Consultant. Reducing Human Suffering. Enhancing Human Thriving. 3mo Edited Report this post Last month, I hosted an international Polymath Retreat in Corfu, Greece with brilliant minds from Canada, the USA, Brazil, England, Switzerland, and the Netherlands‚Äîa true global gathering. 

We had a diverse, well-balanced group, with roughly half male and half female participants. 

Our mission was bold: to begin tackling some of the world‚Äôs most pressing global issues.

Did we figure out how to save the world in a three-hour workshop? No. But did we start an important conversation and document our insights? Absolutely. And will we build from this foundation? Without question. 

This is just the beginning, but it‚Äôs a necessary start.

Humanity must self-organize differently if we are to solve the polycrisis on a global scale. 

Who can rise to the challenge? Polymaths‚Äîthe systems thinkers, the big-picture problem solvers. 

Let‚Äôs support the right polymaths to help save humanity, because they just might be the ones who can. #Polymathy #GlobalSolutions #PolymathPower #SolveTheCrisis #TeamHumanity 15 2 Comments Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in 570 followers 52 Posts View Profile Follow Explore topics Sales Marketing IT Services Business Administration HR Management Engineering Soft Skills See All LinkedIn ¬© 2025 About Accessibility User Agreement Privacy Policy Cookie Policy Copyright Policy Brand Policy Guest Controls Community Guidelines ÿßŸÑÿπÿ±ÿ®Ÿäÿ© (Arabic) ‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶Ç‡¶≤‡¶æ (Bangla) ƒåe≈°tina (Czech) Dansk (Danish) Deutsch (German) ŒïŒªŒªŒ∑ŒΩŒπŒ∫Œ¨ (Greek) English (English) Espa√±ol (Spanish) ŸÅÿßÿ±ÿ≥€å (Persian) Suomi (Finnish) Fran√ßais (French) ‡§π‡§ø‡§Ç‡§¶‡•Ä (Hindi) Magyar (Hungarian) Bahasa Indonesia (Indonesian) Italiano (Italian) ◊¢◊ë◊®◊ô◊™ (Hebrew) Êó•Êú¨Ë™û (Japanese) ÌïúÍµ≠Ïñ¥ (Korean) ‡§Æ‡§∞‡§æ‡§†‡•Ä (Marathi) Bahasa Malaysia (Malay) Nederlands (Dutch) Norsk (Norwegian) ‡®™‡©∞‡®ú‡®æ‡®¨‡©Ä (Punjabi) Polski (Polish) Portugu√™s (Portuguese) Rom√¢nƒÉ (Romanian) –†—É—Å—Å–∫–∏–π (Russian) Svenska (Swedish) ‡∞§‡±Ü‡∞≤‡±Å‡∞ó‡±Å (Telugu) ‡∏†‡∏≤‡∏©‡∏≤‡πÑ‡∏ó‡∏¢ (Thai) Tagalog (Tagalog) T√ºrk√ße (Turkish) –£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫–∞ (Ukrainian) Ti·∫øng Vi·ªát (Vietnamese) ÁÆÄ‰Ωì‰∏≠Êñá (Chinese (Simplified)) Ê≠£È´î‰∏≠Êñá (Chinese (Traditional)) Language Sign in to view more content Create your free account or sign in to continue your search Sign in Welcome back Email or phone Password Show Forgot password? Extracted_Text:
#indigenomics #indigenouspower | Katie Fitzmaurice Agree & Join LinkedIn By clicking Continue to join or sign in, you agree to LinkedIn‚Äôs User Agreement , Privacy Policy , and Cookie Policy . Skip to main content LinkedIn Articles People Learning Jobs Games Join now Sign in Katie Fitzmaurice‚Äôs Post Katie Fitzmaurice Executive Vice President at Invest Vancouver 1y Edited Report this post ‚ÄúWe have described for you a mountain.
We have shown you the path to the top.
We call upon you to do the climbing.‚Äù
~ Chief Commissioner Murray Sinclair
TRC Commission

The #Indigenomics by Design conference has served to inspire, educate, and humble me. The thought leaders, change agents, and community builders that have presented and participated in the event have made clear what #indigenouspower is and the impact of that power and success.

Some sources of inspiration (and this is not at all comprehensive so I encourage future attendance at the event!) include:

üîãIndigenous People‚Äôs are leading the clean energy transition. 
‚ñ´Ô∏è‚ÄùIndigenous inclusion means a just transition to a clean energy future.‚Äù ~ Carol Anne Hilton, MBA ‚ñ´Ô∏è Research from a 2020 Indigenous Clean Energy Social Enterprise report identified 197  Canadian companies in the clean energy sector.
‚ñ´Ô∏è Research from Chris Henderson was cited, noting ‚ÄúIndigenous communities are the third largest owners of clean energy companies in Canada.‚Äù

üß≠ The theory of change must chart the straightest line between the current and future state. This must involve meaningful and deep consideration of what economic reconciliation means and a commitment and plan to advance it. Without this understanding, there is a risk of advancing projects merely for marketing purposes, missing true impact. 
‚ñ´Ô∏è Recommended reading: Raven Impact Measurement Framework (RIM)
‚û°Ô∏è https://lnkd.in/g-jhVn4Q by Raven Indigenous Capital Partners . 

ü§ù Partnerships are key to advancing economic development and building indigenous prosperity.

Further reflections of the learnings of today and yesterday are required. Deepest gratitude to all in the room and event organizers for creating this space and opportunity. 25 1 Comment Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter Karen Lamare 1y Report this comment Thanks for sharing! Meritorious Service Medal 11mo Report this post Indigenomics SHE - Beyond Resilience.

This annual gathering in Winnipeg is a space to amplify Indigenous women who are advancing the Indigenous economy in so many ways. Last year was litüî•! Come hang with us again this year, it‚Äôs going to rock üòé #Indigenous Carol Anne Hilton, MBA, ICD.D Founder of #Indigenomics movement- Indigenomics Institute, Global Centre Indigenomics & Indigenous Technology House. Entrepreneur, Author x 2, Speaker, Advisor. Advancing #IndigenousEconomy & IndigenomicsAI #indigenousAI 11mo We're thrilled to welcome back Ashley Richard and Diane Roussin BA, BSW, M.S.M. ü¶¶ as our emcees for the Indigenomics SHE conference this September in Winnipeg!

Indigenomics SHE is more than just a conference‚Äîit's a space where our stories as Indigenous women in business take centre stage. From sharing our journeys of identity and growth to triumphing over challenges and celebrating successes, every moment is filled with inspiration and connection.

Let's come together to amplify the voices of Indigenous women in business, honor our journeys, and forge connections that fuel our collective growth.

My "why" is simple: I believe in the power of empowered founders and businesses to change the world.
That's why I'm passionate about both REV Global and ayana Foundation Here's how they fit into the bigger picture:
* REV Global:¬†At REV Global, we equip businesses with the tools and resources they need to¬†thrive. Stronger businesses create more jobs, drive innovation, and fuel economic growth. This creates a ripple effect of positive change.
* Ayana Foundation:¬†The Ayana Foundation fosters a supportive community where founders can connect, share experiences, and learn from each other.¬†Empowering¬†and¬†uplifting¬†these individuals is key to their success, which translates into a wider impact on the world.
Together, REV Global and ayana Foundation create a powerful ecosystem for impact. One provides the tools, the other fosters the connections. Both are necessary to empower founders and businesses to reach their full potential and drive positive change.
This is my "why." Together, they break cycles of violence, challenge societal norms, and build stronger, more resilient communities. #16daysofactivism #empoweredwomenempowerwomen Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Laura Chaibi üá®üá¶üá¶üá™ TV Streaming Ad Marketing & Insights Global | Audience Measurement | AVOD | CTV | Advertising Media and Brand Effectiveness | Media Research  | Board Member | Top 50 TV Game Changer | Business Builder 3mo Report this post #GivingTuesday The Women In Research (WIRe) community stays free when we donate - time, effort and funding. 
It's a once a year ask. Our goal is $5000 üôèü§û https://lnkd.in/dhvTUR6M I've been a non exec board member and adviser to Women In Research (WIRe) for 8 years, and committing to another two year term as well as donating, here's why:

üëÄ In the last 8 years it's been about getting women from "she's sweet" to the C-Suite. Seeing really is believing. 

üë≠Amazing things happen when people with a shared vision and values come together at this small and mighty not-for-profit. 

üìà Growth, nearly 30k #members . It's free for individuals to plug into the benefits, funded by companies and individuals investing in women in research. 

üå± Education to #upskill women in #MRX . From soft power, influence, and business and finance saviness. Hundreds of women took the #accelerate program through covid and the new to industry mini course. 

ü§ù 1000s of new alliances have been made through the WIRe #mentorship program. Many of them very senior connections that provide wisdom and open doors. 

üêù Hive minds, faster than #chatgpt abound to help find the right people to connect with. Especially for the tricky things that are best left unrecorded. 

üåè Mobility, people are finding unlooked for opportunities, connections, introductions career changes, skills, new techniques and most of all friendships. 

And yes.... Women have also been coached by other women and men into the C-suite, you know who you are, result!! üèÅ

ü§ç  The beaming faces full of possibility are priceless for the women in developing countries who've been sponsored by WIRe in #scholarships to study #MarketResearch Hundreds of senior dedicated businesses leaders, both men and women invest in women's success in the #insights industry through WIRe. 

I personally help numerous people all over the world move into #mediaresearch , #data and #Insights roles. 

2025 plans? 
We focus on what the community prioritises. #inclusivity starts with speaking up on the 2028 focus. 
Last call to have your say... https://lnkd.in/ eRg6YNWG

A fantastic organisation working with a powerhouse on the board, total awe and gratitude for these amazing people. Skip to main content LinkedIn Articles People Learning Jobs Games Join now Sign in Alison Warwick Fernandes‚Äô Post Alison Warwick Fernandes Senior Manager | Supply Chain - Indigenous Procurement & EDI Procurement, ESG | Ontario Power Generation 6mo Report this post Delighted and honored to be speaking at the upcoming Indigenomics on Bay Street conference October 16-18, 2024! 

I'll be addressing Sustainable Economic Reconciliation and Empowerment with a focus on Indigenous Procurement and Opportunities, highlighting the importance and crucial need to change the narrative to include Indigenous peoples, communities, and businesses in conversations and decision making right from the start.  

Looking forward to insightful conversations and meaningful action! Carol Anne Hilton, MBA, ICD.D Founder of #Indigenomics movement- Indigenomics Institute, Global Centre Indigenomics & Indigenous Technology House. Entrepreneur, Author x 2, Speaker, Advisor. Advancing #IndigenousEconomy & IndigenomicsAI #indigenousAI 6mo Edited Indigenomics Institute is excited to have Cullen Price , Manager, Ontario Securities Commission and Alison Warwick Fernandes , Senior Manager Supply Chain Indigenous Programs, Ontario Power Generation join us to speak on the Corporate Canada‚Äôs Response to TRC Call to Action #92 and Indigenous Procurement. 

These sessions will explore how businesses are advancing economic reconciliation and how Indigenous procurement is driving economic growth by integrating Indigenous participation into supply chains across government and corporate sectors. Learn about opportunities, challenges, and key insights from leading experts.

Don't miss out! Seats are filling fast. Like Reply 1¬†Reaction 2¬†Reactions See more comments To view or add a comment, sign in More Relevant Posts Communities Economic Development Fund Manitoba 365 followers 9mo Report this post The First Nations Major Projects Coalition (FNMPC) held their 7th Annual conference ‚ÄòOur Collective Advantage: Indigenous Consent‚Äô in Toronto on April 22-23, 2024. 

Communities Economic Development Fund sponsored 13 attendees representing 8 Manitoba First Nations attended the conference including:

‚Ä¢	Norway House Cree Nation
‚Ä¢	Garden Hill First Nation
‚Ä¢	Tatakwayak Cree Nation
‚Ä¢	Misipawistik Cree Nation
‚Ä¢	Bunibonibee Cree Nation 
‚Ä¢	Mathais Colomb First Nation
‚Ä¢	Kiciwapa Cree Nation
‚Ä¢	Northlands Denesuline First Nation

The conference was FNMPC‚Äôs biggest event by far, with over 1500 delegates, 200+ companies and over 450 Indigenous representatives. 

The main theme was showcasing how companies that honour and incorporate Indigenous consent across their business and supply chains hold a collective advantage over those who do not. 

Key topics including the unveiling of the National Indigenous Electrification Strategy, Free, Prior and Informed Consent, Canadian Mining and First Nations, and Indigenous Women in Finance. To learn more about the FNMPC, visit www.fnmpc.ca/ 12 Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in F√∂reningen f√∂r utvecklingsfr√•gor (FUF) 5,347 followers 3mo Edited Report this post Minerals from the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) are essential for digitalization and the green transition ‚Äì areas where Swedish companies lead the way. However, their extraction and trade are often linked to serious human rights violations, such as sexual violence and forced labor.

Friends of Panzi Hospital and FUF invite you to an important discussion on the role of businesses in promoting a responsible mining industry that supports peace and sustainability in the DRC and globally.
¬†
We are proud to present an esteemed panel of speakers including Nobel Peace Prize laureate Dr Denis Mukwege; venture capital investor Nyambo Sabuni; award winning journalist Staffan Lindberg; Sweden‚Äôs ambassador to DRC 2019-2024 Henric R√•sbrant; and experts from both civil society and the business sector who under the guidance of moderator Malou von Sivers will discuss:

HOW CAN‚Ä¶
‚Ä¶we balance power dynamics between multinational corporations and weak states to ensure fair resource benefits?
‚Ä¶cross-sector collaboration drive innovation and sustainability while reducing exploitation risks?
‚Ä¶regulations like CSDDD (Corporate Sustainability Due Diligence Directive) strengthen resource management and contribute to peace?
¬†
Join this vital dialogue on Jan 20 and contribute to a sustainable future! Link in bio. #Sustainability #ResponsibleBusiness #MiningIndustry #DRC #SwedishCompanies #EthicalValueChains #CSDDD #PanziHospital #FUF #GreenTransition #Digitalization Malou von Sivers Staffan Lindberg Henric R√•sbrant Eric Kajemba Nyamko Sabuni Henrik Hallgren Alice Blondel Joakim Wohlfeil European Partnership for Responsible Minerals (EPRM) Diakonia Swedwatch International Council of Swedish Industry (NIR) Aftonbladet 19 Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Christos Balaskas Vice President, Commercial, Growth and External Relations (Greece) 10mo Report this post It has been a great honor to participate in the ‚ÄúEmpowering Change: Greece's Journey Towards a Sustainable Energy Landscape‚Äù panel, moderated by @Patti Domm, FWA Board Member and Emmy award-winning financial journalist, at the @Financial Women's Association¬†International Business Conference held in Athens.

During the discussion with esteemed fellow speakers, I highlighted the pivotal role that critical #rawmaterials play not only in national security and economic growth, but also in #Europe ‚Äôs¬†climate goals, strategic autonomy and #greentransition .
¬†
In this direction, Critical Raw Materials Act (CRMA), the flagship legislative initiative to ensure EU‚Äôs secure and sustainable supply of #criticalrawmaterials , creates a remarkable opportunity for #Greece , one of the most well-endowed mineral European countries, to exploit its mineral wealth in a #sustainable way.
¬†
In fact, more than 15 mineral raw materials included in the list of strategic and critical mineral raw materials, have been traced in Greek territory, while our #copper and #gold porphyry deposit at the transformational #Skouries project on the Halkidiki Peninsula in Northern Greece, will play a game ‚Äì changing role for our country, upon commencement of commercial production in Q3 2025. #HellasGold #ResponsibleMining #FWAIBC2024 #FWAIBCGreece 56 Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Gaylor Montmasson-Clair Working for just transitions in the Global South 4mo Report this post Excited to share Southern Transitions ' 1st policy paper on #criticalmineral #valuechains in Africa, written with Lauren Hermanus and Anthony Dane . Download here: https://lnkd.in/d9cYNJfr 31 5 Comments Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Ketakandriana Rafitoson, PhD Executive Director, PWYP / Vice-Chair, Transparency International 3mo Report this post I am excited to be working with colleagues from #NRGI , #SOMO and other key experts this week, at the prestigious Bellagio Center, to build a common strategy on transition minerals value addition & fair benefit sharing. We are giving shape to a core element of the UNSG Panel on Critical Minerals!

This panel‚Äôs recent report proposes the creation of a High-Level Advisory Group to promote "fair benefit-sharing, meaningful value addition, & economic diversification in low- & middle-income (LMIC) producer countries. 

To be really meaningful, this Group must:

‚úÖ Confront deep-seated global power imbalances in trade relations. Free trade has become a huge barrier to LMIC‚Äôs development, locking them into exporting raw material. The system needs to change to deliver shared value & economic equity.

‚úÖ Look at "value-addition" in every sense. It needs to include transformation of minerals in higher levels of the value chain, particularly in clean energy technologies!

‚úÖ Promote collaboration between Southern countries over competition, to build cross-regional value chains. 

‚úÖ Finally, who‚Äôs in the Advisory group really matters to break the status quo. It must include bold voices from CSOs, Indigenous Peoples and government representatives of both consumer and producer countries - especially those challenging global inequalities and trade frameworks.

We must ensure that the Advisory group starts on solid grounds and doesn't overlook these priorities. PWYP and partners are committed to making it happen! The Powering Australia and the Future Battery Industries Cooperative Research Centre teams are proud to have contributed to the ‚ÄòMapping and quantification of CRCs‚Äô work on decarbonisation‚Äô, report written by ACIL Allen and launched at Parliament House by Cooperative Research Australia .

The report provides independent analysis of the contribution of CRCs to Australia's ambitious decarbonisation goals and challenges policy makers to consider flexible funding models for CRCs to ensure their research programs remain responsive to changing industry needs.

Here are six distinct priority areas that the strategy is firmly anchored on which contribute to the achievement of the AU Vision.

Title: Shannin Metatawabin ICD.D's Post - LinkedIn
Description: Feb 20, 2023  ¬∑  #indigenousprosperity #indigenousnationbuilder #indigenomics ¬∑ View organization page for CPP Investments | Investissements RPC ¬∑ CPP¬†...
Extracted_Text:
#indigenousprosperity #indigenousnationbuilder #indigenomics | Shannin Metatawabin ICD.D Agree & Join LinkedIn By clicking Continue to join or sign in, you agree to LinkedIn‚Äôs User Agreement , Privacy Policy , and Cookie Policy . Skip to main content LinkedIn Articles People Learning Jobs Games Join now Sign in Shannin Metatawabin ICD.D‚Äôs Post Shannin Metatawabin ICD.D CEO at National Aboriginal Capital Corporation Association (NACCA) 2y Report this post Thank you Jeffery for making the introduction s and connecting with the Indigenous leaders.   having CPPi as partner is important to the work of making an impact. #indigenousprosperity #indigenousnationbuilder #indigenomics CPP Investments | Investissements RPC 322,835 followers 2y We recently held our first-ever Indigenous Business Forum in Toronto, strengthening our relationships with some of Canada‚Äôs leading Indigenous financial organizations and gaining a deeper understanding of their unique capabilities.

Our President and CEO, John Graham ,¬†spoke about our own investments, such as B.C.-based Premium Brands Holdings Corporation , which was part of "the single largest investment in the seafood industry by any Indigenous group in Canada" through its acquisition of Clearwater Seafoods LP in partnership with a coalition of Mi'kmaw First Nations.

‚ÄúWe seek the best possible investment opportunities ‚Äì wherever they may be,‚Äù Graham says.

Thank you to the First Nations Major Projects Coalition , the First Nations Financial Management Board , the First Nations Finance Authority , NACCA , the Indigenous Growth Fund , the Alberta Indigenous Opportunities Corporation , Longhouse Capital Partners and the Canadian Council for Aboriginal Business for sharing your perspectives and insights.

Advancing #IndigenousEconomy & IndigenomicsAI #indigenousAI 1y Edited Report this post The Global Centre of Indigenomics(GCOI) is proud to announce a powerful collaboration with MOVE37XR ! 

A partnership set to redefine the landscape of innovation and economic empowerment for Indigenous communities globally.
MOVE37XR, a leader in advanced technologies, is bringing its expertise to the Global Centre of Indigenomics, fostering innovation, sustainability, and Indigenous economic growth. 

Together, we aim to create an inclusive and thriving ecosystem that embraces the rich tapestry of Indigenous knowledge and the limitless possibilities of technological advancement.

This collaboration is a commitment to shaping a future where Indigenous communities lead in the realms of technology, economics, and sustainability. We believe that by merging tradition with innovation, we can unlock unprecedented opportunities and drive positive change on a global scale.

Skip to main content LinkedIn Articles People Learning Jobs Games Join now Sign in Carol Anne Hilton, MBA, ICD.D‚Äôs Post Carol Anne Hilton, MBA, ICD.D Founder of #Indigenomics movement- Indigenomics Institute, Global Centre Indigenomics & Indigenous Technology House. Entrepreneur, Author x 2, Speaker, Advisor. Advancing #IndigenousEconomy & IndigenomicsAI #indigenousAI 3mo Report this post Congratulations to our Global Center of Indigenomics board member on earning her Doctorate! Big congratulations Dr. Alisha Murphy!!  you rock! Dr. Alisha L. Murphy Indigenomics 3mo Edited üéì Historic Milestone üéì

Last Friday, I had the incredible honor of earning my Doctorate of Economic Development from New Mexico State University, becoming the first Native American to receive this degree.

This journey has been one of perseverance, passion, and purpose. My doctoral work focused on Navajo entrepreneurship and economic development‚Äîcritical areas that guide my efforts to create sustainable growth and opportunities for the Navajo Nation and other Indigenous communities.

I am deeply grateful for the support of my family, mentors. I am also grateful for my colleagues, and the organizations that have championed the work toward strengthening tribal economic development along the way.

As I look to the future, I am inspired to continue advancing tribal economic development, advocating for data sovereignty, and creating pathways that uplift our communities.

Thank you to everyone who has supported me on this journey‚Äîthis is just the beginning! #Doctorate #EconomicDevelopment #NavajoNation #IndigenousLeadership #DataSovereignty #EducationForChange #Indigenomics 83 5 Comments Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter Ron Norman Director of Pacific Rim Chiropractic Inc. Ocean/Mtn sports specialist. Tofino/Ucluelet.

The Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences has awarded this year's Sveriges Riksbank Prize in Economic Sciences in Memory of Alfred Nobel to ùêÉùêöùê´ùê®ùêß ùêÄùêúùêûùê¶ùê®ùê†ùê•ùêÆ, ùêíùê¢ùê¶ùê®ùêß ùêâùê®ùê°ùêßùê¨ùê®ùêß, ùêöùêßùêù ùêâùêöùê¶ùêûùê¨ ùêÄ. ùêëùê®ùêõùê¢ùêßùê¨ùê®ùêß for their groundbreaking research on how societal institutions shape a nation's prosperity.
üåç Their work underscores a fundamental truth: inclusive institutions‚Äîthose that serve the broader population rather than the interests of a select few‚Äîare crucial for sustained economic growth and development. Their research helps explain why some countries prosper while others struggle, despite similar natural resources or historical circumstances.

When European colonization reshaped much of the world, the type of institutions introduced played a pivotal role in determining future prosperity. Nations with inclusive political and economic systems often experienced long-term success, while those with extractive institutions‚Äîdesigned to benefit elites at the expense of the population‚Äîsaw stagnation and decline.
The laureates also highlight why institutional reform is often difficult: those in power prefer short-term gains and control, while inclusive changes offer long-term benefits for society. In times of political unrest or revolution, however, the path to democracy and inclusive institutions becomes a possibility.

This research is critical in addressing one of our time's greatest challenges‚Äîreducing global income inequality. Their findings provide essential insights into how better governance and institutional reforms can pave the way for more equitable, sustainable development.
ùêãùêûùê≠‚Äôùê¨ ùê≠ùêöùê§ùêû ùê¢ùêßùê¨ùê©ùê¢ùê´ùêöùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß ùêüùê´ùê®ùê¶ ùê≠ùê°ùêûùê¢ùê´ ùê∞ùê®ùê´ùê§ ùêöùê¨ ùê∞ùêû ùê¨ùê≠ùê´ùê¢ùêØùêû ùê≠ùê® ùêúùê´ùêûùêöùê≠ùêû ùêõùêûùê≠ùê≠ùêûùê´ ùê¢ùêßùê¨ùê≠ùê¢ùê≠ùêÆùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêßùê¨ ùêöùêßùêù ùê®ùê©ùê©ùê®ùê´ùê≠ùêÆùêßùê¢ùê≠ùê¢ùêûùê¨ ùêüùê®ùê´ ùêöùê•ùê•. üåçüí° The Nobel Prize for more: https://lnkd.in/g8-xG_b #NobelPrize #Economics #InstitutionalEconomics #Development #InclusiveGrowth #DaronAcemoglu #SimonJohnson #JamesRobinson #Leadership #Innovation #SustainableDevelopment #EconomicReform #LinkedInNews #Nbelprize2024 #economic #GlobalEconomy #IncomeInequality #PolicyChange #Governance #ColonialHistory #EconomicDevelopment #GlobalProsperity #Democracy #InstitutionalReform #EconomicResearch 4 Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Roberto Ridolfi President LINK2007, strategic advisor climate sustainable & blended finance, sustainability, energy, food systems, Africa, BRICS,  CEO & cofounder AWAFARO, Board of EU Mission Climate Change adaptation University Prof 5mo Report this post Migration could be an engine of Sustainable growth and prosperity for all‚Äô. This year‚Äôs Nobel price laureates (three migrants to US)  in the economic sciences @Daron Acemoglu, @Simon Johnson and @James Robinson‚Äîhave demonstrated the importance of societal institutions for prosperity according to the Nobel Institute. But they go deeper in what is a constant battle and reason of pride for Civil Society Organisations in the world dealing with sustainable development like those of the network I chair: Link2007 - Cooperazione in rete They said in fact  ¬´¬†Societies with a poor rule of law and institutions that exploit the population do not generate growth or change for the better.¬†¬ª White we in LINK2007 continue to fight inequalities The laureates‚Äô research can help government economists to understand why. Roberto Ridolfi 9 Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Rio Guerrero, Esq. Guerrero Law Firm / Immigration Solutions / Founding Attorney 3mo Report this post üåü In Honor of Nobel Prize Day üåü

Three immigrants to the U.S.‚ÄîDaron Acemoglu (Turkey), Simon Johnson (UK), and James Robinson (UK)‚Äîhave won the 2024 Nobel Prize in Economics for their groundbreaking research on how institutions shape a nation's prosperity.

üîç Did you know?
Immigrants have been awarded 31% of U.S. Nobel Prizes in Economics, contributing transformative advancements in fields like medicine, physics, and chemistry. These achievements highlight the vital role immigrants play in driving innovation, expanding knowledge, and fostering growth in America.


Post Credit: Stuart Anderson, Forbes @forbes #NobelPrizeDay #ImmigrantAchievements #ImmigrationMatters #GuerreroLawFirm #NobelWinners #GuerreroImmigrationSolutions Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Paul Boucher Researcher at Synopia in international relations, history, geopolitics, and strategic intergovernmental governance / Former archaeologist in the Brazilian Amazon / Professor of international relations. 8mo Edited Report this post I am very proud to participate at the 2nd #TransatlanticSymposium on #SustainableDevelopment in #HigherEducation the  10 and 11 October 2024. After #MIT , the #HAW and the #ESSSR have chosen the #PXLUniversity in #Hasselt My article titled "Environmental destructions: a macroeconomic approach leaded by anthropology" will detail how modern macroeconomy is the resultant of a huge clash between geopolitical, strategical, psychological and social reasons. The upcoming multipolar world will be more than never the theater of states competition where exploring new lands is crucial for food, tools, energies, living places, factories, mines, transports, tourism, military or technical tests. Most of these aspects has direct and indirect impacts on natural areas. This predation-dependence duality defined by a permanent need for supplies of societies is not conductive for a sustainable economy. Until now, the context was torn by a certain opposition between fierce conservatism and an excessive quest for profit.

A closer look at the whole operatory chain from several examples can lead us to understand all the processes which lead countries, consumers and even native people to consent to destroy natural areas yet necessary for interspecies coevolution. This unviable situation can be solved by a better understanding of each mechanism often caused by a lack of global dialogue and diverging interests.

It is also a proposition for some diagnostics in line with the #UnitedNations #SDGs (Sustainable Development Goals) which can be applied to different scales (local, national and international). All indicate several solutions residing on symbiotic economy, innovation, salary guarantee, transdisciplinary dialogue, diplomacy, interconnection between areas and global cooperation between universities, compagnies, government and civil society. From there, future perspectives will emerge.

Thanks to all the team. #anthropology #science #intelligence #ecology #diplomacy #UNO #economic #nature #sustainebleeconomy #strategy #innovation #technology #geopolitics 15 1 Comment Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Vibhu Jain, PhD Portfolio Leader | Innovation | Marketing | Strategy with focus on AI in Drug Discovery, Synthesis Solutions in Chemistry and Materials Science 5mo Edited Report this post üéâ Congratulations to the 2024 Nobel Prize Winners in Economic Sciences! üéâ

Daron Acemoglu, Simon Johnson, and James A. Robinson have been awarded the 2024 Nobel Prize in Economics for their pioneering work on how political and economic institutions shape national prosperity. They have shown how inclusive institutions, such as democratic governance and free markets, promote long-term economic growth by providing access to opportunities for all. Conversely, extractive institutions, which are designed to benefit a small elite (often seen in dictatorships or monopolistic economies), hinder development by limiting the majority‚Äôs access to resources.

Their influential book, Why Nations Fail, provides examples such as:

	‚Ä¢	North vs. South Korea: Despite having the same cultural and historical roots, North Korea‚Äôs extractive institutions have led to poverty, while South Korea‚Äôs inclusive institutions have driven economic success.

	‚Ä¢	Colonial Latin America vs. Colonial North America: The Spanish colonizers implemented extractive systems in Latin America, focusing on resource extraction, whereas settlers in North America established more inclusive institutions, fostering long-term prosperity.

This research explains why some countries thrive and others lag behind, offering vital insights into reducing global inequality. #NobelPrize #Economics #WealthInequality #InstitutionalEconomics #InclusiveGrowth #GlobalDevelopment #DaronAcemoglu #SimonJohnson #JamesRobinson Sources: NobelPrize.org , Business Insider 27 1 Comment Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Kadir Tas CEO @ KTMC AGENCY | Finance Management 5mo Edited Report this post Congratulations to Daron Acemoglu, Simon Johnson, and James Robinson on winning the 2024 The Nobel Prize in Economic Sciences! Your groundbreaking work on the role of #institutions in #economicgrowth has reshaped our understanding of #globaldevelopment . This recognition is truly well-deserved!

U.S.-based economists Daron Acemoglu (Massachusetts Institute of Technology), Simon Johnson (Massachusetts Institute of Technology), and James Robinson (University of Chicago) have been awarded the 2024 Nobel Prize in Economic Sciences. Their prize-winning work, ‚ÄúInstitutions as the Fundamental Cause of Long-Run Growth,‚Äù explores how economic and political institutions shape the development and #prosperity of nations. They argue that inclusive institutions, which allow broad participation in economic and political life, lead to sustained economic growth. In contrast, extractive institutions, which concentrate power and #wealth , hinder development and perpetuate #inequality . This research has had a profound impact on how we understand global disparities in wealth and development. ‚Ä¶more Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in The Zambakari Advisory, L.L.C. 112 followers 5mo Report this post The 2024 Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Sciences was awarded to Daron Acemoglu, Simon Johnson, and James Robinson for their groundbreaking research on the role of institutions in shaping economic prosperity. Their work, particularly focusing on the colonial past, demonstrates how the establishment of inclusive institutions‚Äîprotecting property rights and allowing for broad economic participation‚Äîleads to long-term prosperity. In contrast, countries with extractive institutions, designed to enrich elites at the expense of the broader population, experience short-term gains but long-term stagnation. 

Their research, which highlights the institutional roots of inequality, has influenced economic and political thought worldwide. While their findings favor democratic institutions for sustainable growth, they also acknowledge that authoritarian regimes can achieve short-term economic success, though at the cost of instability and innovation. Their work is particularly impactful in understanding global inequality and the persistence of economic gaps between nations, with a focus on how colonial history shapes modern economies. https://lnkd.in/gjeNZrwH #EconomicNobel #InstitutionalEconomics #GlobalInequality Three Receive Nobel in Economics for Research on Global Inequality https://www.nytimes.com Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in CNR-IRISS Istituto di Ricerca su Innovazione e Servizi per lo Sviluppo 1,525 followers 4mo Edited Report this post üìåStarting tomorrow the Conference "The Future of Hope: an interdisciplinary dialogue"
üîéOver 40 professors and researchers from diverse fields will take part in the Conference to share the findings of their work. Topics to be explored include social innovation, history, theology, medicine, ICT, spatial planning, and artificial intelligence - each framing the theme of hope (understood as vision, orientation, and propensity) within its social, technical, and economic implications.

üëâ Giuseppe Pace , senior researcher at #Cnr_Iriss ,¬†will take part in the Conference focusing on #sustainability and #culturaltransition . He will present key outcomes from two international projects: the Marie Curie-funded #TREND project and the Underground4Value COST Action. Additionally, today he participated in the closed-door meeting ‚ÄúVisions of Hope for Europe and beyond‚Äù within the Roundtable on Sustainability and visions of Future.

Thanks to Renata Salvarani and Guido Traversa from UER - Universit√† Europea di Roma for providing such a great opportunity for interdisciplinary debate and discussion between researchers and policy makers to reflect on how #hope can drive contemporary #challenges and help define visions and solutions for a more #sustainable and #inclusivefuture . 

Find out more üëâ https://lnkd.in/dMQ7TCRM Consiglio Nazionale delle Ricerche CNR DSU - Dipartimento Scienze Umane e Sociali, Patrimonio Culturale #Cnr_Iriss UER - Universit√† Europea di Roma Centro di Formazione Integrale COMECE - The Catholic Church in the EU 3 2 Comments Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Karrie Brown (she/her) Workforce Decoder: Seeing Connections + Creating Solutions as a Business Solutions Manager at West Michigan Works! 5mo Report this post I didn't win the Nobel Prize for Economics this year. I wasn't even in the running, but it is something I follow closely (I know, I am a nerd). 

The winners Daron Acemoglu, Simon Johnson, and James A. Robinson, explored how societal institutions shape prosperity. Their research shines a light on why nations face such different economic realities based on historical and systemic influences. It is worth reading.

While I didn't win, I am enormously proud to be part of the industry sector engagement efforts in my region. Working alongside talented individuals to address systemic workforce issues and tackle inequalities at a local level is an honor. 

By focusing on the collaboration between industries, educators, and workforce development teams, we‚Äôre helping to create a more equitable future‚Äîone where everyone has the chance to prosper.

Building better systems, better institutions, and creating lasting change is rewarding in ways I cannot explain. It is future focused and I know it is making a difference. #SectorStrategies #WorkforceDevelopment #EconomicEquity #CommunityImpact #Proud https://lnkd.in/gTGaXgA3 The Sveriges Riksbank Prize in Economic Sciences in Memory of Alfred Nobel 2024 nobelprize.org 2 Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Qamar Yaseen Makki Founder of Eagle Eyes World | FMCG Sales Leader | Business & Market Growth Strategist | Sales & Leadership Insights 5mo Edited Report this post Nobel Laureates Acemoglu, Johnson, and Robinson: Unveiling the Power of Institutions in National Prosperity

Key Findings:

1. Institutions Drive Wealth: Economic and political systems are key to a nation's prosperity.

2. Colonial Legacy: European colonization left lasting impacts through the types of institutions introduced.

3. Enduring Influence: Institutions persist over time, shaping long-term development.

4. Path to Change: Theoretical tools explain how institutions evolve and how reforms can promote growth.

Hedley Award for Excellence in Social and Environmental Responsibility for its holistic approach to developing a three-year heavy equipment operator program at this years AME Roundup. 

This was an incredible team effort with many partners to make it happen.  The program includes a drivers license program, technical skill development and leadership competencies. It is awesome to watch the program grow and positively impact so many Tahltan members.

The HEO program is a great example that resource projects and Indigenous communities can follow to assist members in gaining mobility, employable skills and meaningful career paths.

His commitment to passing down stories and values to the next generation is evident, reflecting on the strides made in mining.

During Pat's assessment, his outstanding leadership growth stood out. Prioritizing safety and advocating for workers' rights, both on and off the job, exemplifies his dedication.

We extend our heartfelt gratitude to Pat for his efforts in achieving certification. Your contributions are invaluable to Mining Industry Human Resources Council (MiHR) and Centre of Training Excellence in Mining (CTEM) It was a privilege to assess Pat for his Surface Miner Certification. Wishing him continued success in all his future endeavours.

‚ÄúMining to me is a journey back to my roots. Growing up with parents who were miners instilled in me a curiosity about the industry from an early age. Following this path was a natural inclination, and I'm grateful I did.
In this journey, I've delved deeper into the world of rocks and minerals than I ever imagined. I've forged friendships that I know will endure a lifetime. Witnessing mentorship within the crews, regardless of age differences, has been truly inspiring. It's a testament to the power of training and the willingness to learn from one another.
I firmly believe that collective involvement in training and mentorship can transform the mining industry into a safer and more fulfilling environment for all. Being certified isn't just a badge of achievement; it's a reminder of the expertise I've gained and the responsibility I carry as a professional in my field.‚Äù

These past two years have been an incredible ride filled with challenges, victories, and invaluable lessons. Each hurdle I faced and triumph I celebrated has played a crucial role in shaping the person I am today. From navigating the complexities of mining to collaborating with amazing teams, every experience has been a cherished lesson in resilience, adaptability, and continuous learning.

I am thankful to SROL ( Thor Explorations Ltd ) for providing me with opportunities for growth and development. Every day with SROL has been a chance to push my boundaries, embrace new challenges, and grow both personally and professionally.

None of this would have been possible without the unwavering support of mentors, managers, and colleagues who have been there to guide and inspire me every step of the way. I am profoundly grateful to everyone who believed in me and helped me soar to new heights.

Looking forward, I'm brimming with excitement for the adventures that lie ahead. Each day, I'm driven to make a meaningful impact in the mining industry and contribute to a more sustainable and resilient future for generations to come. There's still so much to learn, explore, and achieve, and I can't wait to dive in headfirst.

Skip to main content LinkedIn Articles People Learning Jobs Games Join now Sign in Carol Anne Hilton, MBA, ICD.D‚Äôs Post Carol Anne Hilton, MBA, ICD.D Founder of #Indigenomics movement- Indigenomics Institute, Global Centre Indigenomics & Indigenous Technology House. Entrepreneur, Author x 2, Speaker, Advisor. Advancing #IndigenousEconomy & IndigenomicsAI #indigenousAI 1y Edited Report this post Indigenomics is Indigenous economic intelligence in motion. ¬†
¬†
It is the practice of bringing an Indigenous perspective into economic and social development. It works to connect community economic development practices and principles for building an inclusive local economy.¬†
¬†
Next week 31 leaders are joining the Indigenomics Institute team in Winnipeg to share how they activate Indigenomics as leaders in procurement, investment, equity ownership, trusts, entrepreneurship, finance and technology.¬†
¬†
Indigenomics SHE starts Monday. As part of the groundbreaking Indigenomics series, this dynamic gathering is designed to celebrate and advance real success within the Indigenous economy. This is where economic reconciliation takes action.

Over two transformative days, we will spotlight:
-Groundbreaking Indigenous partnerships
-Innovative businesses and investments
-Policies driving economic reconciliation
-Success stories that showcase Indigenous economic strength

This is where Indigenous-led solutions, business excellence, and investment meet to activate the full potential of the $100 billion Indigenous economy.

Be part of the movement. Registration opens soon!
üì© Sign up for updates: https://lnkd.in/g67cpagb #IndigenomicsIMPACT #IndigenousEconomy #EconomicReconciliation #IndigenousLeadership #FutureofIndigenomics #IndigenousBusiness 11 2 Comments Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Indigenomics 4,887 followers 2mo Report this post The Indigenomics Institute is thrilled to invite leading companies and organizations to take part in the first session of the Indigenomics 50 challenge in Vancouver on April 7, 2025, for a transformative journey towards meaningful economic reconciliation. Through the Indigenomics LEGO Design Sessions, participants will develop actionable Reconciliation Action Plans (RAPs) that integrate Indigenous economic inclusion, cultural respect, and lasting partnerships into their core business strategies.

By participating, organizations will:
üîπ Gain insights into Indigenous economic frameworks rooted in reciprocity, respect, and interconnectedness.
üîπ Co-design actionable strategies that contribute to the rising Indigenous economy.
üîπ Build meaningful partnerships with Indigenous leaders, businesses, and communities to advance economic reconciliation in tangible ways.
üîπJoin a network of forward-thinking companies actively shaping the future of the $100 billion Indigenous economy.

This is your opportunity to take action, drive change, and make reconciliation a priority.

üì© Register now at info@indigenomics.com ‚Äì Limited spots available!

Let‚Äôs move beyond words to action. Don‚Äôt miss out! Registration starts as low as $50 USD and gives you access to exclusive content throughout the year. 

üîó https://lnkd.in/g-7dx-PZ #IndigenomicsNOW #IndigenousEconomy #EconomicReconciliation #GlobalLeadership #Sustainability ‚Ä¶more 40 Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Indigenomics 4,887 followers 4mo Edited Report this post Join us for Indigenomics NOW: Building Business Models for Future Generations content stream. Register now for as low as 50USD to secure your place in these transformative sessions and be part of the movement toward an Indigenous-led economic future. https://lnkd.in/gjspHVwS #IndigenomicsNOW #FutureGenerations #IndigenousEconomy #EconomicReconciliation #SustainableGrowth 12 Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Indigenomics 4,887 followers 5mo Edited Report this post The Investment Environment: Responding to the Rise of the Indigenous Economy is one of the key plenary panels at Indigenomics on BAY STREET, where you‚Äôll hear from industry leaders like Steve Saddleback, ICD.D , Senior Advisor for External Relations at First Nations Major Projects Coalition (FNMPC), and Alanna La Rose , Senior Manager at RBC ‚Äôs Enterprise Strategy Team.

As the Indigenous economy continues to grow, so do the investment opportunities. This session will explore key trends, insights, and strategies for investing in Indigenous businesses and partnerships. Whether you're in finance, strategy, or corporate leadership, this discussion will reveal why investing in Indigenous economic growth matters for the future of Canada's economy.

Attending Indigenomics on BAY STREET offers a unique opportunity to stay ahead of emerging trends and connect with key figures who are driving investment into the Indigenous economy.

Limited seats remain- register now to be part of the conversation shaping the future of Indigenous economic power. https://lnkd.in/gGyxVbtX #Indigenomics #InvestmentOpportunities #EconomicReconciliation #100BillionEconomy #Leadership #RegisterNow 6 Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Iora Ecological Solutions 22,079 followers 4mo Edited Report this post Our CEO, Swapan Mehra , participated in a high-impact convening on ‚ÄúMainstreaming Natural Capital‚Äù held at the Rockefeller Foundation Bellagio Center, from November 11-15, 2024, organised by the World Economic Forum . 

The event brought together 20 visionary leaders from academia, business, civil society, government, and indigenous communities to advance global solutions that can help truly value nature in our economy.
¬†
While there has been significant progress in environmental-economic accounting over the past two decades, many approaches still face challenges in gaining traction due to socio-economic and political barriers. These challenges hinder widespread adoption of strategies that place nature on an equal footing with financial capital.
¬†
In this context, the convening aimed to challenge traditional growth paradigms, propose a bold vision for mainstreaming natural capital in decision-making, and identify actionable solutions for policy, data, and finance.
¬†
Swapan‚Äôs involvement in this critical dialogue reinforces IORA‚Äôs commitment to driving impactful change and innovation in the pursuit of a world where economic development goes hand-in-hand with environmental stewardship.
¬†
The event was a powerful reminder that while we have made significant strides, there‚Äôs still much to be done to ensure that the value of our natural resources is truly reflected in economic decisions. #NaturalCapital #Sustainability #Leadership #Innovation #TeamIORA 39 1 Comment Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in SORA 314 followers 4mo Report this post üéôÔ∏è On Stage Now!

Skip to main content LinkedIn Articles People Learning Jobs Games Join now Sign in Catherine Pennington‚Äôs Post Catherine Pennington Director, Indigenous Advisory Services KPMG, Clinical Counsellor and Psychotherapist / Professional Coach, Facilitator & Mediator / Indigenous & Community Engagement Professional / Proud citizen of the Metis Nation 1w Report this post Congratulations to Snuneymuxw First Nation and Petroglyph Development Group on this exciting acquisition. 

Thrilled for our friends and colleagues in #CorprorateFinance who participated Leo Wilson, CPA, CBV , Adam Paroo , Maggie Huang from KPMG Canada This team and #KPMG understands what these deals mean to communities. Own source revenue is the pathway to sovereignty. Nation owned business creates jobs, creates wealth, and creates healthy communities.

Congratulations to all involved! #indigenomics #indigenouseconomicdevelopment KPMG Canada 348,705 followers 1w Edited Our #CorporateFinance team demonstrates its experience in the hospitality and gaming sectors, acting as M&A advisor to Petroglyph Development Group (PDG) on its acquisition of Casino Nanaimo and Elements Casino Victoria. 

PDG is a wholly owned corporation of the Snuneymuxw First Nation and is dedicated to realizing the economic potential of the Nation. The acquisition of Casino Nanaimo and Elements Casino Victoria is an important milestone for PDG to continue growing a corporate enterprise that reinvests directly into the prosperity of the Nation. Title: Jen Newsted on LinkedIn: #indigenomics #reconciliation #telus
Description: Dec 1, 2023  ¬∑  Jen, thank you for being real. I am grateful for our conversations and the tough but extremely helpful questions you have asked me this year¬†...
Extracted_Text:
#indigenomics #reconciliation #telus | Jen Newsted Agree & Join LinkedIn By clicking Continue to join or sign in, you agree to LinkedIn‚Äôs User Agreement , Privacy Policy , and Cookie Policy . Skip to main content LinkedIn Articles People Learning Jobs Games Join now Sign in Jen Newsted‚Äôs Post Jen Newsted Activating Social Impact & Reconciliation Commitments | Independent Contractor | Settler Disrupting The Status Quo 1y Edited Report this post This year I was gifted ample connection to many fantastic humans who walked alongside the Indigenomics Institute to advance #Indigenomics A trio of fantastic humans that I want to shine my gratitude on are Tashia Kootenayoo, Stephanie Han and Jen Howton from TELUS . It has been a delight to work with these three, to engage in truthful and curious conversations, and have their support in advancing economic reconciliation. Much gratitude to each of you for how you show up!

Last night I read TELUS' recently released 2023 Indigenous Reconciliation and Connectivity Report and I would encourage folks to do the same. https://lnkd.in/g3Yuk7xm I encourage folks to read it for three reasons. The first reason is we, non-Indigenous folks, are grossly overdue on our collective duty to be responding to truth and reconciliation. The second reason is because I have experience both working in telecommunications and leading the Canadian Council for Aboriginal Business Progressive Aboriginal Relations program and I know just how much persistent, intentional effort is required to prioritize reconciliation and shift behaviours inside both giant and small working environments as the barriers to allow change to transpire can and do run deep within each of us as individuals, as a collective and in the colonial system we exist within. 

The third reason is when I read this report I can see that TELUS is both acknowledging they have learning to do AND that they are implementing their learnings from the Indigenous voices they are learning from. This is what reconciliation looks like my friends. 

It looks like Johnny Kelto III being the first voice we hear from followed by acknowledgments of the obligation and responsibility that we non-Indigenous folks/businesses have to ensure there is no longer misappropriation of Indigenous art/artists. 

It looks like bringing our responsibility to be responding to TRC Call to Action 92 to life through prioritized actions that are progressing, not just words in polished corporate copy on websites. 

Give the Indigenous Reconciliation and Connectivity Report a read and invite curiosity in to ask where reconciliation is at with your company/business/self and what will your company/business/self start shifting to ensure you are progressing in persistent, intentional reconcili-ACTION?

No matter how big or small our places of work are reconciliation is required, and it is not difficult. The difficulty, is a barrier that stems from the discomfort of being responsible to acknowledge difficult truths. We must have truth centered in order for reconciliation to happen. So let's get truthful. #Reconciliation #TELUS 27 3 Comments Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter Stephanie Han Senior Program Manager at TELUS 1y Report this comment It's a privilege to be on this journey with you, Jen! Like Reply 1¬†Reaction Jen Howton Senior Strategy Manager - Reconciliation Strategy @ TELUS 1y Report this comment Jen, thank you for being real. I am grateful for our conversations and the tough but extremely helpful questions you have asked me this year about our work. I appreciate you and I recognize the hard work you are doing both professionally and personally. You are a rock star! Like Reply 1¬†Reaction 2¬†Reactions Nathan Grandjambe, MBA Collaborating in resurgent Indigenous sovereignty and prosperity, and more sustainable and equitable relations for all 1y Report this comment hay hay, thank you for inviting so many great people onto your journey of reconciliation and connection. It is a pleasure and honour to count you among my relations. Like Reply 1¬†Reaction See more comments To view or add a comment, sign in 2,136 followers 656 Posts 1 Article View Profile Connect More from this author An invitation: support & celebrate empowerment of women in Vancouver.
