Title: Register for Indigenomics SHE conference in Winnipeg - LinkedIn
Description: Sep 5, 2024  ¬∑  This summit brings together visionaries, innovators, and decision-makers from Europe and Africa to tackle some of the most pressing challenges¬†...
Extracted_Text:
Register for Indigenomics SHE conference in Winnipeg | Jen Newsted posted on the topic | LinkedIn Agree & Join LinkedIn By clicking Continue to join or sign in, you agree to LinkedIn‚Äôs User Agreement , Privacy Policy , and Cookie Policy . Skip to main content LinkedIn Articles People Learning Jobs Games Join now Sign in Jen Newsted‚Äôs Post Jen Newsted Activating Social Impact & Reconciliation Commitments | Independent Contractor | Settler Disrupting The Status Quo 6mo Report this post Friends, and especially those in, around, or with connection to Winnipeg- are you registered for the upcoming Indigenomics SHE conference taking place September 23 & 24 yet?

The reason I ask is because I get lots of asks from folks looking for connections or introductions to Indigenous folks that I might know. 

Here's the secret to you skipping the step of having to ask me who I know: Activate your reconciliation commitments by intentionally prioritizing getting yourself into spaces that are Indigenous led so that YOU are in fact doing the work to meet, connect, cultivate relationships with Indigenous leaders and businesses. 

The learning that comes from being in Indigenous led spaces, like the annual events the Indigenomics Institute hosts, are phenomenally rich and imperative for our reconciliation responsibility. But you know this because I have been telling you which is why you are reaching out to me. Remember this is our shared responsibility.

Indigenomics SHE has 40 Indigenous leaders who will share their insights, experiences, challenges, successes in government, law, finance, tech, education, communications, fashion, art, tourism, culinary, corporate canada, entrepreneurism.

The conference will be hosted and emceed again this year by three epic humans who are shining brightly in the image from last year's SHE conference. Carol Anne Hilton, MBA, ICD.D , CEO and founder of Indigenomics Institute, Global Centre of Indigenomics & the Global Indigenous Technology House, Ashley Richard Director, Indigenous Entrepreneurship University of Waterloo and Diane Roussin BA, BSW, M.S.M. ü¶¶ Project Director, The Winnipeg Boldness Project.

Keynotes are from Laurie Sterritt Managing Partner Pathways Executive Search and Victoria LaBillois, MBA owner of Wejipeg Excavation and founder Eloquent Hostess. 

Additionally, in the room are representatives from Women Entrepreneurship Knowledge Hub (WEKH) , TELUS , Vancity , Alliance Trust Company, Calgary, Canada , BFL CANADA , RBC and Scotiabank who are all actively contributing to #Indigenomics as partners and sponsors.

Reconciliation is about relationships and relationships do not happen in documents collecting dust. Please get in this room AND bring your c-suite, your board members, your teams, your clients because my goodness the opportunities that we have to actually show up in reconciliation are abundant - shift status quo behaviour so you stop being the barrier of why you/your company's reconciliation isn't progressing. 

If you can't physically be there you can still contribute by committing to an Accessibility package that will allow for Indigenous folks to participate on your behalf. This is also how we start to cultivate relationships. 

Finally, here's another super simple way to action reconciliation: Copy the link below and put it in your newsletters. It isn't difficult friends, unless we make it. 

I hope I see you in Winnipeg for #Indigenomics https://lnkd.in/gkG43kUw 38 8 Comments Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter Saxon Miller Consultant @ Pathways Executive Search 6mo Report this comment Will be there! Like Reply 1¬†Reaction 2¬†Reactions Zinat Damji CEO,  Alliance Trust Company  üá®üá¶ 6mo Report this comment So excited and looking fwd to attending again this year!  Last year‚Äôs was so amazing!  So honoured for Alliance Trust Company, Calgary, Canada to be one of the sponsors! Jen Newsted you are so right!  We all need to take active steps towards building solid relationships! Like Reply 3¬†Reactions 4¬†Reactions Hilary Henegar Brand, Community + Culture Builder, Strategic Advisor | Social Impact Eco-System Builder 6mo Report this comment Sharon Marshall will be speaking there as well! Like Reply 2¬†Reactions 3¬†Reactions Kapil Bhutani Mr.MoM - 6mo Report this comment Jen, this is such a powerful call to action! üôå The upcoming Indigenomics SHE conference is not just an event, but an essential space for fostering meaningful connections and fulfilling our shared reconciliation responsibilities. üåç‚ú®

Your point about actively placing ourselves in Indigenous-led spaces resonates deeply. Did you know that Indigenous businesses contribute over $30 billion to Canada‚Äôs economy annually, and yet, so much more can be achieved through genuine relationships and collaborations? The opportunity to learn from 40 incredible Indigenous leaders across diverse sectors is invaluable. üí°

I encourage everyone to show up, bring their teams, and commit to truly shifting the status quo. Thank you for continuously leading the charge and sharing these impactful opportunities! üôè Like Reply 1¬†Reaction 2¬†Reactions See more comments To view or add a comment, sign in More Relevant Posts Jess Mah Unicorn Breeder üë©üåæü¶ÑüöÄ 3mo Edited Report this post üì£ Hey everyone,

I‚Äôm excited to share that I‚Äôm co-organizing a few unique events in the first half of 2025!

ü§ù To be honest, I usually ùò©ùò¢ùòµùò¶ traditional conferences‚Äîthey‚Äôre often poorly curated, overly formal, and feel like everyone‚Äôs just trying to extract value from each other. Life‚Äôs too short for that, so I decided to create the kind of gatherings that bring people together in a meaningful, exciting way.

üóìÔ∏è Here‚Äôs what‚Äôs coming up:
¬†‚Ä¢ ùó£ùóÆùóøùó∏ ùóñùó∂ùòÅùòÜ, ùó®ùòÅùóÆùóµ (ùóôùó≤ùóØ ùüÆùü≥ - ùó†ùóÆùóø ùüÆ): A retreat for successful entrepreneurs and investors. I‚Äôm partnering with my friend Noah Berkson to host an event that combines deep conversations, outdoor adventures, and genuine connection.
‚Ä¢¬†ùó£ùóÆùóπùó∫ ùóóùó≤ùòÄùó≤ùóøùòÅ, ùóñùóî (ùóîùóΩùóøùó∂ùóπ ùüÆ-ùü∞): A retreat for 100 badass female founders, organized with my friends Mada Seghete and Emily Dong . Mada‚Äôs event last year was wildly successful, and we‚Äôre building on that energy with the community we‚Äôve fostered through Badass Female Founders.

üåé I‚Äôm also in the early stages of organizing a trip to the Bahamas for some of the world‚Äôs boldest scientists‚Äîthose who are truly iconoclastic and have a shot at changing the world. This all-expenses-paid gathering will include Nobel Prize winners, the brilliant Michael Levin (known for his groundbreaking work on bioelectricity and regrowing limbs), and other incredible minds working on transformative ideas. If you‚Äôre interested in helping fund bold bio research, I‚Äôd love to keep you posted about this trip!

üåü Why am I doing all of this? Because these events enrich my life. They create opportunities for meaningful relationships, unexpected collaborations, and ideas that can genuinely change the trajectory of lives and industries. And selfishly, they‚Äôre also a chance for me to connect with people I haven‚Äôt had the opportunity to drop in with yet.

If any of this speaks to you, let me know in the comments‚ÄîI‚Äôd love to have you join us on this journey. 108 46 Comments Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Candida Bongini 5mo Edited Report this post Associations today are facing unprecedented challenges and opportunities. 
The Union of International Associations - UIA Round Table 2024 in Florence - 14 | 15 November - offers a unique chance to tackle them head-on.
Register here ü´¥ https://lnkd.in/dX73ptHd ‚ôªÔ∏è Sustainability: It's more than a trend - it's a necessity. Discover actionable strategies to embed sustainability into your Association's DNA, ensuring a lasting positive impact on the world. Plus an incredible gift (and not just the same old gadget) awaits you! - Martina Fondi Treedom üèõÔ∏è Legacy for the Future: What do you want your Association to leave behind? Learn how to create a legacy that leaves added value for the years to come while addressing today‚Äôs challenges - gianni virgili Paolo Limoli INTERNATIONAL SOCIETY OF LOW-VISION RESEARCH AND REHABILITATION üåç Diversity & Inclusion: Learn how to embrace different perspectives and cultures, fostering an environment where every voice matters. Associations are stronger when they are diverse - Diye Ndiaye

üë• Collaboration and üß† Intellectual Engagement: Dive deep into thought-provoking discussions and build connections with global peers who share your vision. The collective power of associations is immense, and this is your chance to strengthen it - Sara Lucatello Michela Pacifici European Astronomical Society Society for Conservation Biology ü§ñ AI & Innovation: The future is now. Get insights into how artificial intelligence and cutting-edge technologies can streamline operations and improve member engagement - stefano Berretti Universit√† degli Studi di Firenze Ryan Brubaker

üîÆ Shaping the Future: The decisions made today will define the path of associations for years to come. Be disruptive at the forefront of this journey and lead your Association toward success - Alberto Mattiello Florence 2024 is where associations come together to not only think about the future, but to shape it. ‚ú® 
Don't miss it! Full programme here üëâ https://lnkd.in/dA83Ct5F Host partners: OIC Group Firenze Fiera SpA Fondazione Destination Florence #UIARoundTable2024 #Diversity #Sustainability #AI #FutureOfAssociations #Teamwork #Legacy #Leadership #Innovation 24 Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Marco Minoni Facilitator | Trainer | Host | 

I help navigate complex conversations, decision-making & collaboration. 

Passionate and writing about inclusion, power dynamics, regenerative cultures, community & change-making 7mo Edited Report this post üåç Exciting news: I'll join the Gathering Of Tribes in Portugal from September 11th to 15th! This event brings together regenerative entrepreneurs, change-makers, activists, and community builders across ecosystems for a co-created experience where we connect, learn from each other, and build community across different initiatives. Initially, I had some reservations (the use of "tribes" did raise a few questions...). However, this event genuinely seems to be a space where regenerators want to share, learn, and remember that we‚Äôre working towards the same goals and cooperation is the way. ü§ùüå±

As part of my participation, I‚Äôve chosen to join Claudia Marras at the CoPartnerUp camp, where I‚Äôll be offering workshops on facilitation, to help participants enhance their power to foster collaboration and co-creation in their teams. I was drawn to this camp because of its focus on fostering meaningful collaborations and partnerships‚Äîareas that are deeply aligned with my work at Moving Mindsets Facilitation . üí¨‚ú®

‚ö°Ô∏è My intention in joining the Gathering goes beyond simply connecting and collaborating. By co-creating a global community of changemakers and facilitators, we can contribute to building a culture of care, genuine transformation, and collective liberation‚Äîall while recognizing the deep disparities that exist in our world, perpetuated by structural barriers and systems of oppression. This collaborative (and often privileged) work must aim not only for greater equity but also for dismantling the oppressive structures that continue to perpetuate injustice. ‚úä

üì£ If you're coming or want to know more about the Gathering (or join me at CoPartnerUp camp), feel free to message me! Let‚Äôs connect, share ideas, and work together towards collective liberation and a culture of care for ourselves, each other, and the planet. üåø‚ù§Ô∏è #GatheringOfTribes #Regeneration #CoCreation #Facilitation #Collaboration #CollectiveLiberation #Care #SocialJustice #Sustainability #Changemakers 19 1 Comment Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in World MAP [Meaning&Purpose Summit] 54 followers 3mo Report this post The World Meaning and Purpose Summit is more than just an event‚Äîit is a movement.

A movement to inspire concrete actions that transform not only our own lives but also our communities and the world around us. This is a call to those who believe that the future belongs to those who dare to live and lead with purpose.

In a world facing a crisis of meaning, many individuals who believe in and dedicate their lives to bringing purpose into the world often feel isolated. Despite their passion and commitment, we can frequently find ourselves navigating this journey alone, feeling the weight of a world that doesn‚Äôt always prioritize purpose and meaning.

At the World Meaning and Purpose Summit, we aim to change that. By connecting globally, we create a powerful network of like-minded individuals who share a common vision of a more purposeful world. Together, we will build a community that offers support, encouragement, and inspiration, reminding each of us of our unique calling and the impact we are meant to make.

We believe that by fostering meaningful dialogue, creating connections, and encouraging actionable insights, we can empower individuals and organizations to lead with authenticity, resilience, and purpose. 4 1 Comment Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Nanaimo Prosperity Corporation 812 followers 6mo Report this post The Summit You Can‚Äôt Afford to Miss

The State of The Island Economic Summit is more than just an event‚Äîit‚Äôs a game-changer for Vancouver Island‚Äôs economy. üíº‚ú®

With conference delegates spending an average of $390 per day and the conference centre injecting $105 million into Nanaimo since 2008, the impact is substantial. üíµüìä

But, this summit isn‚Äôt just about numbers; it‚Äôs about driving real prosperity. By fostering valuable partnerships among business owners, community leaders, and entrepreneurs, it's propelling the Island forward. üåü

And it‚Äôs not just about the local scene. Hosting this summit enhances Vancouver Island‚Äôs reputation as a key economic hub, attracting interest and investment.

Here‚Äôs what‚Äôs in store:

üî∑ Action Lab Workshops: Dive into hands-on learning.
üî∑ Breakout Sessions: Engage in deep discussions and skill-building.
üî∑ Networking Opportunities: Connect with industry leaders and peers. 
üî∑ Keynote Speakers: Gain insights from influential voices. 
üî∑ Panel Discussions: Participate in engaging debates on key topics.
üî∑ Trade Show: Discover innovations from 40+ exhibitors. 

Nanaimo Prosperity Corporation is excited to see you there. Don‚Äôt miss out! 

For more details, click the link in the comments.üîóüëá 21 3 Comments Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Planet Health Innovation Network 521 followers 7mo Edited Report this post We had the privilege of hearing from Lucas Hunter of B Lab , a remarkable nonprofit organisation, at the recent Planet Health Table discussion. Lucas highlighted a critical insight: ‚ÄúTo transform the system companies understand that they must work in a collective way.‚Äù ü§ù B Lab Spain is paving the way for this transformation by creating spaces where diverse organisations can come together, connect with key stakeholders, and collaboratively drive change for #Health and the #Planet ‚Äî both environmentally and socially. üå±

One standout initiative is Barcelona + B‚Äîan alliance of businesses, educational institutions, the public sector, social and cultural entities. This alliance exemplifies Lucas and his team‚Äôs ambitious vision for a more interdisciplinary approach to tackling global challenges. üåê

However, as Lucas pointed out, ‚ÄúThe biggest challenge we are facing as a movement is to settle the expectation between times.‚Äù‚è≥ The public sector often moves slowly, taking years to implement regulations, which can be a significant hurdle for private sector initiatives. Yet, it's through these challenges that innovation thrives, as both sectors learn to work together more effectively.

Let‚Äôs keep pushing forward, inspired by B Lab‚Äôs vision and commitment to collective action! üöÄ #Sustainability #Collaboration #Innovation #PublicPrivatePartnership #Sustainability #PlanetHealth Jordi Serrano Pons , Jordi Alcal√† Torr√≥ , Luismi Roura , Trinidad De Frutos Herranz , Kathrine Raleigh , Manel Balcells , Michael Donaldson , Magnolia Restrepo S√°nchez , Montse Guardia Guell , Claudia Fernandez de Cordoba Farini , Elena Codina , Anna Sala Cunill , Jaume Duran Navarro , Esteve Picola , Carla Oliva Morell , Sonia Hern√°ndez-Monta√±o Bou , Josep Maria Pique Badia , Marta Anglada Roig , Lucas Hunter , Joan Bigorra , Tim Eaves 61 2 Comments Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Institute Of Neurodiversity (ION) 22,060 followers 6mo Edited Report this post The Institute Of Neurodiversity ION is joining the United Nations at the
üåç Summit of the Future on 22-23 September in New York. Find out more about the event at https://lnkd.in/gfqeZHi9 üåç What is the Summit of the Future?
The Summit is a high-level event, bringing world leaders together to forge a new international consensus on how we deliver a better present and safeguard the future.

ü§ù Effective global cooperation is increasingly critical to our survival but difficult to achieve in an atmosphere of mistrust, using outdated structures that no longer reflect today‚Äôs political and economic realities.

üåü This once-in-a-generation opportunity serves as a raise the profile of neurodiversity and demonstrate that international cooperation can effectively achieve agreed goals, tackle emerging threats, and seek new opportunities.

Why the Summit matters
üîÑ The speed and complexity of developments have outpaced our systems for cooperating and coping.

üåç The benefits and opportunities of progress are spread unevenly, with the majority of people left behind.

‚ö†Ô∏è The risks and threats are also unevenly felt, disproportionately impacting the most vulnerable.

üåê Multilateral governance, designed in simpler, slower times, is not adequate to today‚Äôs complex, interconnected, rapidly changing world.

‚ú® The Summit is an opportunity to take the next steps towards neuroinclusion. 

ION received special accreditation to attend in person as one of the only neurodiversity-focused civil society organisations. Kim Shah , Country Lead of the Institute of Neurodiversity ION Canada , and our Global Lead Silvan Ruthenberg (üîñ) will be representing our members, advocating for our #humanrights and #neuroinclusion globally.

ü§ù We hope to forge many new connections, partnerships, and alliances to jointly create a more inclusive and sustainable world!

üìÖ If you are in New York 19 ‚Äì 24 September ‚Äì for the SOTF or otherwise and would like to meet, please get in touch. 26 4 Comments Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Jason Luboyera CEO & Founder lead b2b LinkedIn Social Selling | I can help you attract quality business relationships & leads 3mo Report this post Happening tomorrow. You should join me!! [4th of December in Cape Town].

I‚Äôm honoured to be speaking at the SEADE R&I Summit, hosted at the Cape Town International Convention Centre (CTICC). 

This summit brings together visionaries, innovators, and decision-makers from Europe and Africa to tackle some of the most pressing challenges of our time‚Äîclimate tech, digital transformation, and sustainable development.

Why am I so passionate about this? Because Africa has an extraordinary opportunity to redefine its place in the global innovation ecosystem. 

This isn‚Äôt just about participating‚Äîit‚Äôs about leading. 

With the right collaboration and investment, we can shape solutions that not only uplift Africa but also contribute to a more interconnected and sustainable global society.

The SEADE R&I Summit is unique because it unites some of the smartest minds to understand how we move forward together as a global society. 

It‚Äôs not just about conversations; it‚Äôs about creating actionable steps to bridge the innovation gap between continents.

I‚Äôd love for you to reflect on these questions:

1. What does the future of climate tech and digital transformation look like when Europe and Africa collaborate?

2. How can we better position Africa‚Äôs talent and resources to shape global solutions?

If you‚Äôre passionate about these topics or simply curious about what‚Äôs possible when innovation knows no borders, I invite you to join the conversation. 

Let‚Äôs challenge assumptions, explore opportunities, and inspire change.


üé± Will I see you there? 



üíÅüèæ‚ôÇÔ∏è Let‚Äôs connect at the event or in the comments below! 28 2 Comments Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Generous Minds 2,054 followers 1mo Report this post ùó™ùó∂ùóπùóπ ùòÜùóºùòÇ ùó∑ùóºùó∂ùóª ùòÇùòÄ ùóºùóª ùüÆùü¥ùòÅùóµ ùóôùó≤ùóØùóøùòÇùóÆùóøùòÜ ùó≥ùóºùóø ùóÆùóª ùó∂ùóªùòÄùóΩùó∂ùóøùó∂ùóªùó¥ ùó≤ùòÉùó≤ùóªùòÅ ùóºùóª ‚Äòùó£ùóºùòÄùòÅ ùóöùóøùóºùòÑùòÅùóµ ‚Äì ùóî ùóΩùóÆùòÅùóµùòÑùóÆùòÜ ùòÅùóº ùóÆ ùòÅùóµùóøùó∂ùòÉùó∂ùóªùó¥ ùòÄùóºùó∞ùó∂ùó≤ùòÅùòÜ ùòÑùó∂ùòÅùóµùó∂ùóª ùó≤ùó∞ùóºùóπùóºùó¥ùó∂ùó∞ùóÆùóπ ùóπùó∂ùó∫ùó∂ùòÅùòÄ‚Äô? üå≥ 

This event is hosted in collaboration with Post Growth Expert Melanie Rieback ( University of Amsterdam ) and Generous Minds . üôå 

Infinite growth is not possible on a planet with limited resources. We are all aware of the problems our traditional economic system leads to. Post Growth is not anti-growth. It is about rethinking what kind of growth we need for a thriving future. For example, we need more growth of renewable energy, but we need less excessive growth in waste or luxury goods. üìä Generous Minds organizes this event because not many people are yet aware of the opportunities and challenges Post Growth brings for companies, financiers, and expertsüí°

 üëâ Are you an expert supporting or collaborating with impact-driven companies, seeking a clear, pragmatic explanation of Post Growth?

We‚Äôre looking forward to seeing you there! #impactmeasurement #impactstrategy #postgrowth #businessopportunities 32 4 Comments Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in Melissa Pole Founder & CEO @ Pyralume | Tech Architect | SSHRC Researcher, PhD 4mo Report this post SAAS NORTH Conference is one of my favorite events of the year. The hospitality is always exceptional, and I love connecting with other founders, investors, and VCs within the local ecosystem.

One of the standout moments for me was during the keynote talks, where Martin Basiri shared profound insights on leadership. He spoke with such vulnerability about how being a founder means leading with your heart. His words resonated deeply when he said, ‚ÄúIf I‚Äôm not fixing a problem, I‚Äôm not satisfied" after joyfully poking fun "I wouldn‚Äôt be happy sitting on a beach.‚Äù It was funny, relatable, and a perfect reflection of the passion that drives founders and their crazy dreams.

This year was particularly special, as I had the chance to connect with incredible people like Forbes journalist Monique Danao, share moments with The Firehood who I pitched to last year when my company was only a few weeks old, and they honoured how far Pyralume has come. It was my first time pitching it last year when I approached Simon Constantineau at Inovia Capital who said his minimum cheque is 1 million. Maybe I was just a little early. üòâ

 Always a great time with Suzanne Grant, CD and seeing Jennifer Batley üíï I love exploring new opportunities & partnerships with other founders & industry professionals. I even met inspiring women from my hometown in Muskoka, like Lauren Valliere , who‚Äôs making waves in Fintech that I'm meeting with later today üêù

These gatherings are so much more than conferences to me‚Äîthey're opportunities to share stories, learn from each other, and strengthen both new and old relationships. Skip to main content LinkedIn Articles People Learning Jobs Games Join now Sign in Dirk Lock, BA‚Äôs Post Dirk Lock, BA | Design Anthropologist | Multilevel Design and Futures Researcher | 9mo Report this post Reconciliation and recognition of Indigenous histories and cultures means in National Indigenous Month, and National Indigenous Peoples Day tomorrow. Facilitation of community engagement on systems changes and service management is an encouragement to discuss equity economic growth, social and health services, and rights to education.

A human centered collective that values and acknowledges knowledge pathways and awareness of policies that support Indigenous authorities on language, stewardship, and historic knowledge. Community health and wellbeing is a shared experience, sustainability along a path of decoloniality. Carol Anne Hilton, MBA, ICD.D Founder of #Indigenomics movement- Indigenomics Institute, Global Centre Indigenomics & Indigenous Technology House. Entrepreneur, Author x 2, Speaker, Advisor. Advancing #IndigenousEconomy & IndigenomicsAI #indigenousAI 9mo Edited What does #Indigenonics mean to you?
At the Indigenomics Design conference, we asked a few people what it means to them. Yamila Franco Ashley Richard Ifeoma Ngwudike, CPA, CMA #saskatoon #indigenous #wealth Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter To view or add a comment, sign in More Relevant Posts Samantha Panter Two Spirited Cultural Ambassador, DEI Strategist, Indigenous Advisor at K'waahlgahlda 9mo Report this post To me Indigenonics means, looking at the systems, the communities, and individuals then the journey to financial prosperity. 

What does the ‚Äúcustomer journey‚Äù look like in accessing resources?

I have faced this time and time again. People in a financial authority saying that becauwe I‚Äôm Indigenous I have access to so many resources and benefits, yet the journey to access those is so beyond ‚Äúbroken‚Äù. It‚Äôs discouraging and disappointing. 

My work is centred around the journey of accessing whatever it is that the person or business is striving towards. 

A plan, goal, or vision is wonderful but the steps in that journey need to be clear and simple. Otherwise we are walking in place; no change. Carol Anne Hilton, MBA, ICD.D Founder of #Indigenomics movement- Indigenomics Institute, Global Centre Indigenomics & Indigenous Technology House. Entrepreneur, Author x 2, Speaker, Advisor. Title: Paul Lacerte (Gilam Giloh), OBC's Post - LinkedIn
Description: Jan 31, 2023  ¬∑  TELUS Pollinator Fund for Good#reconciliation #Indigenomics #investments #indigenousbusiness ¬∑ View organization page for Raven Indigenous¬†...
Extracted_Text:
#indigenomics #investments #indigenousbusiness | Paul Lacerte (Gilam Giloh), OBC Agree & Join LinkedIn By clicking Continue to join or sign in, you agree to LinkedIn‚Äôs User Agreement , Privacy Policy , and Cookie Policy . Skip to main content LinkedIn Articles People Learning Jobs Games Join now Sign in Paul Lacerte (Gilam Giloh), OBC‚Äôs Post Paul Lacerte (Gilam Giloh), OBC Co-Founder and Chief Purpose Officer, Raven Indigenous Capital Partners 2y Edited Report this post Teh Beh Mussi Cho (Thank you from the bottom of my heart) for the good medicine that is being shared with our People through this Fund and the investments it will enable.  This milestone represents our shared effort to shift the economic paradigm towards reconciliation, love and healing and I am deeply honoured to be on that journey with our team at Raven Capital, with each of our investors, and with all the incredible Indigenous Founders that we invest in.  By working together, we are implementing Article 3 of the UN DRIP and we are implementing the spirit and intent of the Truth and Reconciliation Commission (TRC) Calls to Action.  Deepest gratitude. Stephen Nairne Jeffrey Cyr Jeff Ward Lawrence Lewis Bobbie Racette Jenn Harper Keith McIntosh Aaron Aaron Lambie Aaron Joe Amber Buker, J.D. Ginew Navajo Power Home Jace Meyer Carol Anne Hilton, MBA Clint Davis Denise Williams Jay Calhoun Kate Finn Garry McBerryhill Devon Krainer Mitch Langan Alisa Denduyf Joshua A. Jonas Hunter Sage Lacerte Valerie Red-Horse Mohl Rally Assets Canadian Council for Aboriginal Business National Aboriginal Capital Corporations Association (NACCA) Common Approach to Impact Measurement Kate Ruff BDC Export Development Canada | Exportation et d√©veloppement Canada FCC / FAC InBC Investment Corp. TELUS Pollinator Fund for Good #reconciliation #Indigenomics #investments #indigenousbusiness Raven Indigenous Capital Partners 10,107 followers 2y Edited Raven Indigenous Capital Partners is excited to announce the final closing of a historic $100M (CAD) Indigenous venture capital fund to support Indigenous and Native American entrepreneurs. This fund addresses critical gaps in the Indigenous finance ecosystem and provides a culturally grounded approach to investing. 

The closing of this fund is a critical inflection point for both Indigenous Peoples and impact investing that highlights the positive state and growth of the Indigenous economy. Indigenous and Native American entrepreneurs are rightfully taking their place at the forefront of the economy. 

Backed by some of North America's most prominent foundations and financial institutions, Fund II will build on the success of Fund I to invest exclusively in Indigenous and Native American enterprises that demonstrate commercial viability, potential for scale, and measurable community benefit streams. ‚ÄúOur hands are raised in gratitude to all our Fund II investors. This is economic reconciliation in action and an implementation of Article 3 of the UN Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples,‚Äù said Paul Lacerte, Managing Partner and Chief Impact Officer, Raven Indigenous Capital Partners. 

‚ÄúBy providing the capital and the support that Indigenous entrepreneurs require to succeed, we will continue to build innovative and resilient Indigenous economies that are good for our People and good for the planet.‚Äù Jeff Cyr, Managing Partner for Raven Capital and CEO of the Raven Indigenous Impact Foundation. #Indigenousbusiness #Nativeamerican #Nativeamericanbusiness #impactinvesting 56 6 Comments Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter Seth Asimakos Social Entrepreneur 2y Report this comment Awesome to hear. Congratulations to the whole team! I love your work and fund and plan to tell a lot of folks about you!!! #indigenousprosperity #indigenomics #gerryrocks | Shannin Metatawabin ICD.D | 24 comments Agree & Join LinkedIn By clicking Continue to join or sign in, you agree to LinkedIn‚Äôs User Agreement , Privacy Policy , and Cookie Policy . Skip to main content LinkedIn Articles People Learning Jobs Games Join now Sign in Shannin Metatawabin ICD.D‚Äôs Post Shannin Metatawabin ICD.D CEO at National Aboriginal Capital Corporation Association (NACCA) 3y Edited Report this post It is so important to highlight people in our lives who demonstrate allyship.¬† These souls care about and understand the barriers, inequities and injustice perpetuated on Indigenous peoples.¬† I would like to recognize NACCA CSO Gerry Huebner for his unrelenting passion and contribution to the AFI network. 
We worked together 20 years ago with Aboriginal Business Canada and now we work together administering and growing this program and network. Over the last number of years we introduced a market ready Indigenous Growth Fund, a Women's program, renewed AEP support, rolled out Covid business supports, solidified the Indigenous Prosperity Forum¬† (one of the most impactful events in Canada), added 500M in programming - which will lead to positive socioeconomic impacts for our communities. One dollar added, in turn multiplies back into the whole economy.¬† Thank you Gerry, Thank you to your powerhouse of a fianc√© Kim, and the entire NACCA team, network and board for your contribution to bettering society as a whole and making Indigenous Prosperity a reality. My heart is full from all of your efforts. #indigenousprosperity #indigenomics #gerryrocks 108 24 Comments Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter Radek Bandzierz Director General at Canadian Government (Ret) 3y Report this comment Good one Gerry Like Reply 1¬†Reaction Gordon Miles Retired 3y Report this comment Well deserved! #indigenomics | Dennis Meeches Agree & Join LinkedIn By clicking Continue to join or sign in, you agree to LinkedIn‚Äôs User Agreement , Privacy Policy , and Cookie Policy . Skip to main content LinkedIn Articles People Learning Jobs Games Join now Sign in Dennis Meeches‚Äô Post Dennis Meeches President of Tribal Councils Investment Group 2y Report this post July 5, 2022
Fyi. Working to advance #Indigenomics Have a blessed day and safe travels to all. Indigeno Travel 638 followers 2y We're thrilled to announce that Dennis Meeches, former longtime Chief of Long Plain First Nation, and more recently the chief spokesperson for the seven First Nations of Treaty One, has accepted the position of Chair of the Board of Directors of Indigeno Travel.

Dennis was instrumental in the economic growth of Long Plain's Arrowhead Development Corporation, made major contributions towards securing Naawi-Oodena (formerly known as Kapyong Barracks), and currently sits as President of Tribal Councils Investment Group.

Under Dennis' leadership, hundreds of jobs have been created. He is an excellent fit for leading Indigeno Travel with our goal to hire, train and employ Indigenous people in the travel industry. 63 7 Comments Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter Alan Lagimodiere 2y Report this comment Congratulations Like Reply 1¬†Reaction Michael Meeches Personal Assistant 2y Report this comment Congratulations Dennis!!! Title: Jani Djokic (she/her), MES' Post - LinkedIn
Description: Aug 2, 2022  ¬∑  " - Steve Rennalls, Operations Manager, Snowline #greeneconomy #indigenomics. One of the three main components to the system, the solar¬†...
Extracted_Text:
#greeneconomy #indigenomics #mineralexploration | Jani Djokic (she/her), MES Agree & Join LinkedIn By clicking Continue to join or sign in, you agree to LinkedIn‚Äôs User Agreement , Privacy Policy , and Cookie Policy . Skip to main content LinkedIn Articles People Learning Jobs Games Join now Sign in Jani Djokic (she/her), MES‚Äô Post Jani Djokic (she/her), MES Chief Executive Officer at Na-Cho Nyak Dun Development Corporation

Shaking things up. Investing in circular economies. 2y Edited Report this post Thank you to all the folks at Snowline Gold Corp. (CSE:SGD)(OTC:SNWGF) and Solvest Inc who helped make this happen with us. Special thanks to Ben Power , Scott Berdahl , Steve Rennalls , and Kara Kolkman for bringing all your creativity to the table on this file and making space for greener solutions at remote exploration sites via investments and innovation from Indigenous businesses.

This project was supported with funding from Yukon Development Corporation and Northern REACHE, under the Office of the Minister of Crown-Indigenous Relations #greeneconomy #indigenomics #mineralexploration Na-Cho Ny√§k Dun Development Corporation 890 followers 2y NACHO NYAK DUN DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION ANNOUNCES AN AGREEMENT WITH SNOWLINE GOLD TO POWER MAIN CAMP WITH A LARGE-SCALE SOLAR GENERATOR

TUESDAY, AUGUST 2, 2022 ‚Äì MAYO, YUKON: The Nacho Nyak Dun Development Corporation (NNDDC) has entered into a 5-year agreement with Snowline Gold Corp. (CSE:SGD)(OTC:SNWGF) (Snowline) to lease a 27-kilowatt portable solar generator system for Snowline‚Äôs exploration project in the Selwyn Basin. This project is located within the Traditional Territory of the First Nation of Na-Cho Nyak Dun (FNNND). This investment will help reduce carbon emissions and provide economic benefits within the green economy.
This solar generator, which was designed and built by Solvest Inc and is one of the first of its kind in the Yukon, will be used to power Snowline‚Äôs off-grid 45-person "Forks‚Äù camp on its Rogue Project in the Eastern Yukon. Estimates provided by Solvest, based on data collected from Snowline‚Äôs 2021 field program, predict the new solar generator will have estimated total fuel savings per season of 12,572L of diesel and reduce the camp‚Äôs direct diesel consumption by up to 90% for the season. Not only does this project help to reduce direct consumption, but also reduces the indirect fuel consumption required to transport fuel to the site, which includes trucking fuel to Mayo and then to the site via airplane. This will have a net positive impact on the project from an environmental and financial perspective.

‚ÄúInvestments such as this are examples of how Indigenous businesses are leading the way in accelerating the green economy, and innovations such as this provide opportunities for such entities to become increasingly engaged in the mineral resource sector. We see this investment as just the first of many of its kind and we are working towards building a fleet that can be deployed throughout the Traditional Territory.‚Äù - Jani Djokic (she/her) , CEO, NNDDC

The system consists of 3 main components: the power module, the battery module and the solar panel module. The size of the system was based on data collected during the 2021 exploration season. The system reduces the generator operating time and fuel consumption. Reduced operating time for the generator allows camp noise to be reduced, creating a better quality of life for employees due to the reduction of noise pollution. The reduction in sound is also expected to have a positive impact on the wildlife in the surrounding areas. Installation of the solar generator is complete, and the system is now fully operational, providing a majority of the camp‚Äôs power.

"This project is a tangible representation of how Snowline is realizing our Corporate Vision. It increases efficiency while creating financial and environmental value. It improves our employees' work environment, it is yet another partnership with the NNDDC, and it is being provided by Solvest, one of Yukon's most innovative companies." - Steve Rennalls , Operations Manager, Snowline #greeneconomy #indigenomics 41 4 Comments Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook Twitter Vidya Vankayala 2y Report this comment Very inspiring outcome, glad to see large scale solar project like this happen Like Reply 1¬†Reaction Michael Bakaic üß≤ Cyber Lead Magnets for MSPs | Founder @ Iceberg Cyber üßä 2y Report this comment üëè Like Reply 1¬†Reaction Matthew Simard Pre-Construction | Sustainability | VDC 2y Report this comment Awesome work! Exciting project and a great team! Like Reply 1¬†Reaction Sonny Banjac, AScT, B.Tech. Experienced technical sales specialist with leadership experience spread across civil construction, renewable energy and manufacturing industries. 2y Report this comment Glad to see that NNDDC has continued to advance it's renewable energy aspirations. Keep up the good work Jani. All the best.
